dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man lets himself into a large room that looks like Mi Control. He pours himself a cup of coffee. It is the week and the place is empty. No one has been there to see the displays flashing a distinctive shape -- a pulse followed a series of echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man looks up at the screen, then DROPS his cup of cof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory headquarters at Caltech is a frenzy of activity. POSTDOCS and RESEARCHERS huddle around monitors and printouts, arg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANSEN, 60s, the director of LIGO, walks through the frenz A postdoc hands him a printout: a pulse followed by echoe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen steps into the relative calm of a large, sunlit off which overlooks a grassy stretch of Caltech's campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ASSISTANT, 30s, is on the phone, on hold. He looks up at Ansen as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on hold with the INS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think we should double check the triangulation before we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have double checked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone finally picks up the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm trying to reach- (pause, listens) No, I don't think you understand how serious this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you did, we'd be having this conversation in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens for a moment, then hangs up the phone, confuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said we should look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen steps to the window and looks out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the courtyard below, coeds are scrambling to get out o the way as a military helicopter sets down in the middle the quad and dozens of ARMED FEDERAL AGENTS converge on h building. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen sits, alone, on one side of a conference table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side is filled with GOVERNMENT MEN -- NSA mostl some DIA. The door opens and his assistant steps in. Arme guards pat him down, then shove him into a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the NSA agents leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been complaining for years that the government doesn't take your project seriously enough, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have it both ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen motions to his assistant, who turns on a projector. On-screen, we see the familiar pulse and echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday morning, our facility in Hanford identified this signal: a neutron star colliding with a supermassive black hole. We went through the last year's data and triangulated the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pulse is translated into a crude animatic of a neutro star circling into the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that, Doctor. What we don't know is why, according to your numbers, this event took place right here in our own solar system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the image overlays the sun, the earth, and the rest of our solar system around the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't. Because if it had we'd all be dead by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On-screen, Jupiter, then the Earth and the inner planets consumed by the black hole. Only the sun survives, pulled into orbit around its new master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leaves only one explanation: The signal traveled through a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wormhole. A gateway to a distant corner of the universe. The black hole is on the far side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On-screen, the black hole system is removed to a distant corner, connected to ours by a tunnel through space-time. gravity wave from the collision travels through the tunne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read your book, Doctor. You said that wormholes are impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing quite as satisfying as being proved utterly wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that a wormhole couldn't exist naturally. Not for more than a few billionths of a second. It would have to be... stabilized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilized by what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen pauses, unsure. His assistant steps in to his defen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any way to answer that question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not under peer review here, Doctor. I don't care about your reputation. I need to know how that thing got there. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ansen finally speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're worried about an invasion, I would start drafting the articles of surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever they are, if they can build a wormhole, they could erase us in the blink of an eye. Luckily, that also means we have nothing they could be interested in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is it there? 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe it's an invitation. A chance to commune with an advanced species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant, embarrassed, looks down. The agent notices

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think we can assume an alien intelligence built the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the opportunity it represents is incredible. We could explore parts of the universe we never dreamt of reaching in our lifetimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent exchanges a look with one of his colleagues, wh steps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get back to work. I have a conference call with our European partners in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We severed the connections to your European partners this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that. The Europeans put up some of the funding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll send them a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your project is now classified under the State Secrets Act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out the door, leaving the men alone. The assista outraged, turns back to his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't keep this a secret. You know that. Sooner or later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The younger man looks down, embarrassed, as he notices th tears are rolling down the older man's cheeks. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about that. I've spent my whole life being afraid we would wipe ourselves out before this moment arrived. We've made so many mistakes, I wasn't sure we'd make it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assitant realizes that the old man is weeping for joy Relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this will change everything. Fifty years from now, nothing will be the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older man looks at the simulation on the screen of th tiny link between our galaxy and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn. As far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large old diesel tour bus is parked by the side of a di road, smoke pouring out of its open hood. A dozen MEN in BASEBALL UNIFORMS are standing around the front of the bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered PICKUP pulls up, and a MAN, 30s, gets out, lea his two SONS in the car. This is COOPER. He joins the ballplayers staring at the lifeless diesel engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seized up on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way to come by bus. I thought you guys would have a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did. Ran out of parts for it. You know anything about diesels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps to the engine compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballplayer notices Cooper's two boys, TOM, 15, and MU 10, watching them. He wanders over. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your dad's going to be able to help us out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, a filth-encrusted kid with a black eye, smiles at ballplayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad can fix anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except maybe your fastball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballplayer frowns: smartass kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment under the hood, Cooper signals to the driv who tries the engine. It turns over once, then STARTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure appreciate the help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't make it, my boys won't get to see you lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballplayers load up into the bus and as it pulls away we can see the logo painted across the back of the bus fo the first time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth spins, lazily. From this height, it looks much the same as it has done for thousands of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a tiny black object appears, racing toward Eart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The object SMASHES into a large satellite and races onwar Behind it, the satellite spins out of orbit in a cloud of fragments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old minor league stadium. The stands are barely halfwa full. Cooper, his boys, and Cooper's father-in-law, DONAL 60s, have a row to themselves behind the dugout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph offers his grandpa some popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popcorn at a ball game is unnatural. I want a hot dog. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a hot dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, play stops on the field below as the players an fans look up at the night sky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright blue streak is tearing across it. It's beautiful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a comet, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Satellite. Big one. Probably Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the fireworks as the satellite burns up the upper atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, play resumes -- it's a pretty show, but everyone has seen it plenty of times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down on the field, the Dodgers' catcher misses an easy po fly and the Yankees load the bases. Donald looks disguste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper guides his truck along a potholed road. His father in-law is riding shotgun; the boys are sleeping in the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those clowns would get their asses handed to them by the ballplayers I grew up watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ruin it for the boys when you talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing my grandkids any favors by lying to them. They're growing up watching lousy baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't have any baseball at all when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shuts the old man up for now. They drive on in silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is gently landing on the horizon, painting the se of corn around Cooper's modest house gold. Cooper walks o of his house, still eating his breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald is on the porch, looking at a black clouds of smok in the distance. The neighboring fields are BURNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelson's burning up his crops. Found some of the blight on the okra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches the men walking through the fields, settin fire to the crop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought okra wasn't susceptible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better safe than sorry. (looks at him) You've got to take the boys to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parent-teacher conference day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper bends his head in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice to Murph's teacher. She's single, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be repopulating the earth. Gotta pull your weight. Besides, the boys could do with a woman in their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys run out of the house and pile into the truck. Co pulls away before Donald can continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper weaves the car along a dirt road. The kids are arg over an ancient comic book in the back seat. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns around to break it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG -- one of the tires blows out in a foot-deep pothole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper examines the flattened tire. Looks at his older so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the spare, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We'll use the patch kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the back of the truck. Murph suddenly looks very glum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I think the patch kit might not be there... (off his look) Because I was using it for my bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down at the dirt. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph's law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom snorts with laughter. Turns to his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid doesn't even know what he was named after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shoots Tom a look -- enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph's law means what can go wrong will go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, looking hurt, walks off. Cooper turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find something to patch it with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to do that? 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out. I'm not always going to be here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper leaves Tom to catch up with his younger son, who i looking out over the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really why I'm named Murph, dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Murph's law doesn't mean that. It means what can happen will happen. All kinds of things. Good or bad. And that's the way you want it to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if nothing ever happened to you then you wouldn't learn anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is staring off into the distance. He's heard someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Cooper hears it, too. A LOW RUMBLING SOUND. Cooper looks out over the river. Then he turns back and tackles his son to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a MASSIVE AIRPLANE SOARS overhead, so close the can almost touch it. It bounces the truck on its suspensi then soars off over the fields behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper grabs Murph and races back to the truck. He pulls laptop and an antenna made out of a Pringles can out of t back of the truck. He hands the laptop and antenna to Mur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is still standing by the side of the road, wrestling with the jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the tire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is SMASHING through the cornfields as fast as C can push it on three good tires. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is hurriedly firing up the laptop and connecting it the directional antenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is straining to see through the cornstalks, scanni the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right, the dark shape of the Russian drone appears flying low over the fields. Cooper jerks the wheel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck BURSTS out of the corn and SPLASHES across the river and into an old, abandoned suburban housing develop in the valley below, planted over with corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a mile in front of them, the Russian drone is still hugging the ground. It has impossibly long, skinny wings, like an old U-2 surveillance plane, but no cockpit. The tops of its wings are covered in black solar cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is fiddling with the computer. His older brother ta the computer from him and fires up emulation software.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Chinese military drone. Solar cells could power an entire farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hands Murph the Pringles can antenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it pointed right at it, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph nods. Tom takes the wheel as his dad works the lapt trying to communicate with the huge Russian drone. The sc fills with Cyrillic characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster, Tom. I'm losing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom WEAVES the truck at speed through the old, curved str of the development, past oversized suburban mansions plan over with corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner and come face-to-face with a robot harvester. Tom jerks the wheel to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG -- the truck loses a wing mirror against the flank o the combine. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom guides the truck from street to street, trying to cha a straight path across the fields. The truck BOUNCES as i SMASHES through an old picket fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, the drone is soaring, banking, pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still trying to hack into the drone's control circuitry as they leave the development behind and begin climb into the foothills of the Sierras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom guides the truck along the spine of the hills. The dr soars overhead, making for the white tips of the Sierras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is oblivious to the picturesque surroundings as he concentrates on the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got it. Don't slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them, Tom and his brother watch as the drone plummets from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks up. Ahead, the trail disappears as the edge the hills falls away -- it's a three hundred-foot drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom locks up the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck skids to a halt inches from a precipitous drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper climbs out, holding the laptop. Murph climbs out next to him, still pointing the Pringles can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we didn't. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the drone SOARS back over them. Cooper types a couple keys and then moves his fingers across the trackpa The huge drone banks and turns in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the boys watch, Cooper sends the drone soaring high ov them, banking and soaring along the tree-lined sides of t valley, light glinting from the black panels on its back. It's a beautiful sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper crouches next to Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to give it a whirl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks at his dad, wide-eyed. He takes the laptop an moves his fingers gingerly across the pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response, the massive plane banks into a tight turn in the valley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Murph is in pure heaven, sending the drone dancing through the valley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set her down in the valley -- there, next to the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph leads the plane in a figure eight and then begins guiding it into a gentle landing in the valley floor belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck limps along the overgrown fairway of a long-def golf course towards the massive hulk of the Russian drone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the boys climb down. The valley is silent save for the truck's engine WHEEZING and SPUTTERING as it cool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper runs a hand over the smooth carbon flank of the dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think it's been up there, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinese mission control went down same as us, twenty years ago. It's been up there ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it doing flying so low?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper reads the information pouring into his laptop. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was looking for something. Intercepted some kind of signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been at eighty thousand feet. Sun probably cooked its brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper runs his hand along the flank till he finds an acc patch. He pulls out a crowbar and pries open the hatch. Inside, surrounded by a nest of liquid cooling tubes, is small black module -- the drone's auto-pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down at Murph, who is standing at his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reprogram it. Give it something socially responsible to do like drive a combine or a tractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't we just let it go? It's not hurting anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down at his son. Good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need all the help we can get, Murph. This thing has to adapt, just like the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gently pries the control module out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small school, so all the kids and parents waiting front know exactly who's driving the pickup truck with ha of a Russian spy plane hanging out of the bed as it pulls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is ushered into the office. The PRINCIPAL, 40s, an efficient-looking man, shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Mr. Cooper. This is Ms. Kelly, Murph's teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles at Ms. KELLY, 30s, attractive. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we've gotten Tom's score back. Congratulations. He's going to make an excellent farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal slides a carbon copy across the desk to Coo who looks taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The University of California only accepts a few hundred students a year, Mr. Cooper. You have to be realistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ruling out college for him now? He's only fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm afraid Tom's score simply isn't high enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, about a 36-inch waist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30-inch inseam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me you need two numbers to measure your own ass, but just one to measure my son's future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Kelly stifles a laugh, then, with a look from the principal, takes on the appropriate look of offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you're a well-educated man, Mr. Cooper. A scientist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, the world doesn't need any more engineers. We didn't run out of trains or television sets or satellites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran out of food. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper leans back. He's not going to win this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world needs farmers, Mr. Cooper. And I'm sure your son Tom is going to make a fine one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a caretaker generation. But things are getting better. Maybe your grandchildren will be able to attend college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down, swallowing his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing. Ms. Kelly here says that Murph brought a book to school about the lunar landings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides an old textbook with a picture of a rocket on t cover across the desk to Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my old textbooks. Murph liked the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KELLY
dialogues.text: This is one of the old federal textbooks. We've replaced them with corrected versions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corrected?

dialogues.speaker: MS. KELLY
dialogues.text: The new textbooks explain that the Apollo lunar missions were faked in order to bankrupt the Soviet Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe we went to the moon?

dialogues.speaker: MS. KELLY
dialogues.text: I believe it was a brilliant piece of propaganda. The Soviets spent years trying to build rockets and other useless machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Useless machines"? 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks to the Principal for help. None is forthcomi

dialogues.speaker: MS. KELLY
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Cooper. The kind of wastefulness and excess that the 20th century represented. Your children would be better off learning about this planet, rather than reading fantasies about leaving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is silent for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those useless machines they used to make was called an MRI. If we had any of them left the doctors might have been able to find the cyst in my wife's brain before she died, rather than afterwards. And then my kids could have been raised by two parents, instead of me and their pain-in-the-ass grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Kelly's face falls, ashen. Cooper swallows his anger. Most of it, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever consider the best thing for the world and humanity might have been for us to part company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper climbs into the truck, trying to hold it together. He PUNCHES the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio KEYS to life. He ignores it. Sits for a moment in misery. Finally he picks up the handset.

dialogues.speaker: CB OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Got a call from Riggs, down in Galveston. Says some of the tractors you built him went haywire last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him to power down the controllers for a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CB OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I did. He wants you to come down in person anyway. Says he found something you should take a look at. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares at the wheel. Shakes his head in frustratio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pulls his truck up to a grimy-looking hangar. Pull a tarp off of an ancient Piper Cub. Checks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper guides the plane along a long sliver of deserted b The radio crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo-two-eight, requesting permission to enter your airspace.

dialogues.speaker: AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Permission granted. Welcome to the sovereign nation of Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop hangs up the radio. Banks the plane inland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, a combine harvester fights its way up the dunes, t to reach the beach, its wheels struggling for traction in the soft sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN waves up at Cooper's plane as it circles overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper lands the plane on a deserted roadway. Jumps down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He intercepts one of the combines as it trundles past, tr to reach the dunes. He pops open the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is a mess of wires hooked into an auto-pilot not u the one he ripped out of the drone. He checks the fault code and resets the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man jogs over to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming down. Half of 'em took off last night, looking for something. (points to dunes) Looks like they found it, too. I thought you were the man to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs starts walking up the dune. Cooper follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, on the beach, a dozen more combines and other farm vehicles are lined up at the tideline, warm gulf water la at their metal flanks. They are circling a deep crater. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, an ancient autonomous SUB BEACHES itself, trying to reach the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps between the waiting machines and peers down into the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the very bottom is a ROUND BLACK BALL, about a foot ac the same object we saw punch a hole in the side of a satellite. Every few seconds, it emits a distinctive CHIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper checks his rad meter. A tiny reading -- non-lethal He takes off his watch and hands it to Riggs. Then he sli down into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe CHIRPS as Cooper slides down on top of it. He rubs a hand across its smooth composite bulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's an alien?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper wipes sand off of the object, revealing the faint, familiar outline etched into the side of the probe:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stars and stripes of the old federal government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a rope and a winch, Cooper hauls the blackened prob out of the crater and onto the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hefts it up and carries it to the back of his plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space probe. Never seen one like it, though. Looks like it's been to hell and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe CHIRPS as Cooper belts it into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think it wound up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost, I guess. Guidance satellites would have been shot down by the Chinese twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the probe for a second, admiring its form 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald is pouring a bottle of corn beer into a bubbling v of chowder. He turns to watch Cooper work, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe has been clamped to the kitchen table. Cooper works at the blackened case with a BLOWTORCH. Cooper give up -- the torch hasn't made a scratch. The probe CHIRPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know what the hell it's made of, but I can't crack it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Clear it off the table so I can serve dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Murph walk in. Murph's got another black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got suspended. Paul said anyone who believed we went to the moon was an idiot. So I hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy. Hand me the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph hands his dad a defibrillator he's modified for the purpose. He attaches the shock pads to the sides of the probe and turns on the power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbers flash across the screen. Cooper hits a button on the controls and it PULSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Standard NASA encryption. Memory's been damaged. Just noise. Hold on. I've got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper unplugs a monitor from his computer and plugs it i the defibrillator. After a moment, an image fills the scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ICE-COVERED PLANET nestled in the center of a system impossibly dense with stars. Murph stares, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is that, dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the probe. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shrugs. Turns off the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take it down to Tyson's tomorrow and have it melted down. Might be some copper inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about its mission? What about the information onboard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one for it to report to. NASA is all gone. I'm sorry, son. It got home too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald pulls his chowder off the boil and slides the pot unceremoniously onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys have gone to bed. Cooper and Donald are alone at the table. Donald hands Cooper another beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard your meeting at the school didn't go so well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's better for everyone to forget what they did back then. Reminds us how far we've fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks down,) When I was kid, it felt like they made something new every day. Some gadget or idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like every day was Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we made a lot of mistakes. Six billion people. Just try to imagine that. Every last one of them trying to have it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald rolls the bottle of beer in his hands. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is this world isn't that bad. In a lot of ways its better. Tom will be all right, whether he goes to college or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't bother me that he can't go. It bothers me that he doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom isn't the problem. He fits in this world just fine. You're the one who doesn't fit, Coop. You don't belong here. You were born forty years too late, or forty years too early -- I don't know. My daughter knew it, god bless her. And your kids know it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald drains his beer. Walks to the screen door. Stops, one hand on the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were good at something and you never got a chance to do anything with it. And I'm sorry, Coop. But that's not your kids' fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald pushes out the screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at his beer. The probe CHIRPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper flops down on his bed, fully clothed, exhausted. H stares up at the ceiling. This is his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is filled with a PIERCING NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper BOLTS upright. Stumbles out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's boys are in the hallway, exhausted. Cooper, hold a baseball bat, makes his way down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper uses the bat to open the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps in, Murph watching from behind him. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe is clamped to the table, the chirp replaced wit DEAFENING SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, holding his ears, moves closer to the probe. He hits it with the paddles. No result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMASHES it with the bat. Nothing. He HITS it AGAIN and AGAIN. Finally, the clamps break off chunks of the table and the probe slams to the ground and ROLLS toward the fr door. As it rolls, it STOPS SHRIEKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the others watch it roll toward the door. It stops at the wall. After a second, it begins SHRIEKING AG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper grabs it and rolls it toward the front door. Once again, the movement shuts it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and his boys roll the probe out of the front door. It BUMPS down the front steps and comes to rest in the di After a moment, the unholy RACKET starts up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper keeps rolling it, but it doesn't seem to help. Mur looks up, sees the stars overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a different direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they roll the probe in a circle, its SHRIEK stops, the picks up again. Cooper zeroes in on the direction that ke it quiet -- southwest -- and pushes it along in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fail-safe. It's going to annoy us into taking it home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stops rolling the probe and, after a moment, it be SHRIEKING again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gets a rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins tying the rope around the probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper wakes. He's been sleeping with a pillow wrapped ar his head. The SHRIEK can be heard, but it's muffled, dist 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom heads off for school with Donald. Murph, still suspen looks up at Cooper, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staying here and cleaning the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks crestfallen. He looks out towards the yard. Cooper follows his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Murph. There's no one to take it back to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if there is, dad? What if there's something we can salvage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper thinks it over. Murph scrambles to get his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shriek is still muffled. Cooper walks over to the wel putting in a pair of earplugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line is staked off, leading down into the well below. Cooper begins hauling the line up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the probe breaks the surface of the water, the SHRIEK returns to its normal volume. Cooper rolls the probe out onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe CHIRPS next to Murph in the backseat as Cooper spins the plane and guns the throttle and they bounce alo the dusty runway and into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny plane follows the mountains south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper flies in low. Los Angeles looks much the same way did in the early 20th century -- small settlements in San Monica and Downtown. Wildfires and earthquakes have shake and burned what was left of the homes in between. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper puts the plane down on the old highway and taxis u to a gas station. Ahead, the Coast Highway peters out and disappears beneath rows of wild grass -- Malibu has becom ranchland, once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD MAN looks up as Cooper steps out of the plane and checks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any diesel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty. Shame you can't eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stretches the hose over to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper rests a hand lightly on the controls as he follows the coast. Murph gazes out the window. In the backseat, the probe is HUMMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light marine layer beneath them parts, revealing SANTA CRUZ ISLAND, a large, uninhabited island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cooper soars over the island, the probe HUMS, insisten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper circles the island until he finds a long, flat grassland in the center of the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane bounces and hops to a halt in waist-deep grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph and Cooper climb down from the plane. Cooper slings rifle over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few dozen yards from the plane they reach the tree line Murph stops, mesmerized by a patch of weeds studded with bright red -- strawberries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, what are these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Don't touch them. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper spots something in the foliage ahead that looks a little off. He walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pokes at the undergrowth with his rifle. The rifle CLA against something metal. Cooper reaches -- it's a camoufl scrim. He gently pulls it aside, revealing a chemical transport truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps back, alarmed. He brings up his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around. Murph is nowhere to be seen. Cooper curs and heads into the forest to look for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks through a glade. He stops to get his bearing Leans against a tree. Snatches his hand back -- the trunk of the tree is red hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps back -- it's not a tree at all, but a camouf chimney stack. He looks up: the tree is venting steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks a little further, until he finds several mas tanks. The tanks are filling with a bubbling liquid -- so kind of industrial process is taking place beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper finally catches up with Murph at the edge of a clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. There's some kind of underground facility here. We might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper notices his son is frozen, staring at something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing bolt upright in the middle of the clearing, wear an old straw hat, is an eight-foot-tall military spec ROB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it still... alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be. It's a marine. Haven't made them for thirty years. I've never seen one intact before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps closer to the robot, which is frozen. Its al frame heavily tarnished and weather-beaten. It looks like it might have been standing here for decades. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper moves closer to it, looking into its blackened eye He steps back, clearly a little spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we need to go, Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But can't we take it back? You could fix it up, get him to do chores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't know what this place is, but we're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, ignoring his father, steps forward to touch the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the robot SPRINGS into action, picking up the b and hoisting him up to eye level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, stunned, points the rifle at the robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot turns, dropping the boy, RIPS the rifle from Cooper's hands, BENDS it, then SLAMS him up against the s of the water tank. Cooper punches him, then winces in ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph picks up the rifle and begins HITTING the robot as hard as he can. The robot opens his mouth and addresses Cooper calmly in the clipped tones of a US marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the boy to stop hitting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him in the back of the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph raises the rifle butt. A voice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman, 30s, step out from the trees. This is AMELIA BRA tough, bright, and a decent shot with the large rifle tha she's pointing at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just looking for salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they call stealing these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know it belonged to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to let them go, Tars, or do you want some help with your work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot, evidently named Tars, looks at Cooper closely. Then lets him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got me wrong, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You're not the kind of guy who turns a combat marine with a supercomputer for a brain into a riding lawn mower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper says nothing -- she's not that far off the mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back in your little plane, go back to your farming commune. And don't come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper backs up. Tars holds up his mangled rifle. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at Tars) Word of advice -- careful with that thing. When the war was over, they didn't know when to stop fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd trust him a lot more than I'd trust you. Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper backs up to his plane. Tars follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, in the plane, the probe emits a high-pitch SQUE Tars responds instantly, striding past Cooper to the plan He sees the probe. Tries to open the door. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars TEARS the door off the plane. Reaches inside and pul out the probe. The woman looks at it, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points rifle at Cooper) You too. We'll figure out what to do with you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars stops, and two panels open in the ground, revealing huge, reinforced service elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand waves at a security camera and the lift begins to g diagonally down a tunnel that cuts hundreds of feet below the island's surface. She keeps her weapon shouldered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who's stealing from who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't belong to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It belongs to NASA, which shut down thirty years ago when the federal government ran out of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand says nothing. The elevator slows to a stop at the bottom of the tunnel. Heavy BLAST DOORS grind open and Br motions for Cooper to step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into a vast underground facility. Standing in t center, braced by a launch tower, is a ten story tall roc Dozens of ROBOTS are working on in, maintaining it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, stunned, looks at Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government gave us plenty of practice looking for our own funding. (gestures with rifle) Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars carries the probe over to an area of the hangar fill with electronic equipment. A group of ENGINEERS and ROBOT converge around Tars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER ENGINEER looks familiar -- 70s, white-haired, th is Ansen's assistant at Caltech who we met fifty years earlier. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found them outside with it. It looks like six. Maybe seven. I can't tell from the radiation damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older engineer looks at the probe, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galveston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking it over) Of course. It must have been looking for Canaveral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars bolts the probe down into a purpose built rig. DOYLE 40s, an engineer, begins hooking leads into the probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canaveral's been gone for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks up from his monitor, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not responding to the handshake. I can't open anything on primary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks up at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I got something off of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around. There's a safety station on the wall with a battery powered defibrillator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand nods, wary. Cooper walks over to the wall, takes th defibrillator, and hooks it up to the probe. He taps into the current and runs a lead into the terminal. Brand's Fa watches, fascinated, as Cooper fires the defibrillator. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. The high voltage allows you to image the entire memory unit at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information begins appearing on the terminal's screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the disk was noise. Couple of clean sectors, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the monitor starts pulling good data off of the probe. The older man and Doyle begin sorting through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles at Brand, who seems less than impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The footage of the ice-covered planet Cooper saw earlier pops onto the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engineers and physicists get very quiet, studying the images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very thin nitrogen-based atmosphere. Trace radiation. Surface is ninety percent frozen water. Ten percent rock -- sedimentary composition similar to limestone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Pockets of oxygen below the surface. Lots and lots of oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be the one, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older engineer studies the image of the ice-covered planet, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any planets like that anywhere near earth. Not even if this thing was gone for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at Cooper, appraising. She turns to the older engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heard enough. If we're going to launch, we need to keep them here until afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep us here. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could endanger the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to endanger it any more than you already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper points to a telemetry unit that is being repaired a robot on a nearby bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you using that for guidance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? We've tested it a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power supply is no good. If the voltage fluctuates under load, the unit will fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now how could you possibly know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought thirty of them off a guy in Florida. Had to rebuild every last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work great on a riding lawn mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks back at the telemetry system. The older engin watches the exchange, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Murph have been locked in an abandoned machine shop, surrounded by the massive remains of rocket engines various states of disrepair. Tars is blocking the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands. Tars wags a long, hydraulic finger at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You plan on keeping us here forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My battery has a duty cycle of five hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gives up. He turns back. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the shop is filled with a group of older ROBO who are overhauling an engine. One problem -- the engine isn't there. Their programming hasn't been updated to ref their obsolescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph watches, entranced, as the robots go about their business, efficiently TORQUING bolts with impact drivers into a non-existent thruster cone. The bolts CLATTER to t ground as the robots stop to reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing, dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess no one told them they were out of a job. (nods at Tars) Same as the rest of these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper notices through the glass door of the lab that Bra and the older engineer are arguing about something. She finally relents and walks towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand walks in. She gestures for Cooper to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mission commander wants to see you. Your son can stay here. He'll be all right with Tars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper eyes Tars warily. Then steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk across the space towards the base of the rocket away from the other engineers. Cooper nods at the older engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the old man was in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'old man' is my father. And he was in charge. But he decided that we needed someone who could lead the mission for the foreseeable future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a biologist. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like one. (off her look) With the rifle, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand heads towards a group of large maintenance ROBOTS clustered at the base of the rocket. A smaller, human siz robot is staring at the rocket, giving them instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot looks up. This is CASE, the leader of the missi Originally an air force pararescue officer, every part of him, from his alloy chassis to his voice, was designed to inspire respect and confidence. He turns to Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man who brought us the probe? (off his look) Thank you. We tested the telemetry board you warned us about. It failed under high voltage, just as you said. Come with me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case strides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights dim as Brand's father brings up a schematic of our solar system. Case points to the picture of the ice planet recovered from the probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Mr. Cooper. The planet you saw is a long way from earth. A very long way indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks down. Case notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our science officer doesn't think I should trust you with any of this. One of the curious things about humans is that the more alike you are, the more initially hostile you are to each other. As if by design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand makes eye contact with Cooper, then looks away, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found the best way to earn a person's trust is to trust them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Brand's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's father taps a few keys and the schematic he built fifty years beforehand flickers onto the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wormhole. A shortcut leading to a galaxy on the far side of the universe. We found it fifty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the animatic, taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: BRAND'S FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been waiting, sending probes into it for decades. None of them ever came back. Not until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case walks to the schematic. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on the information on the probe, we're finally preparing to send the manned mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That rocket doesn't have enough thrust or fuel to get you to Jupiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main ship was built in orbit. It has nuclear engines, with enough fuel to last for several years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? I already told you I'm not going to tell anyone about this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't, Mr. Cooper. We're telling you this because I want you to join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at him. Is he serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe has taken a great deal longer to return to us than we hoped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Brand's Father and several other members of our crew have gotten... older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's Father looks down, stoic. Brand looks angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need someone who can run the systems, improvise, work with what's available. All of the skills you seem to have developed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't have any of the experience. Any training. You people have been preparing for this for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans worry about things like rank and experience. I'm only concerned with whether someone would be useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd be useful, Mr. Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is stunned. This is the offer he's waited his whol life for. And it's come too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is deeply conflicted. But he can't leave his boys behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help you. I have responsibilities. Things that, no offense, are more important than a scientific mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a scientist, Mr. Cooper. And this is not a scientific mission. It's a rescue mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises and shakes Cooper's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand can show you the way out. I hope you'll reconsider. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case steps to the door. Cooper looks at Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue? Rescue who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air HISSES as it's run through an exchanger and a fil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the second set of doors open. Cooper squints -- the light is blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are standing in a sealed corridor in the middle of a massive underground greenhouse. Through the glass, Cooper can see an acre or so of corn plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the plants. They're all badly wilting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the last century strands were limited to one or two species. But this one targets everything. Essentially it's more efficient at consuming our food than we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the dying corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't affect the corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. But it will. We've grown a dozen forms of it that can. It's just a matter of time before the same ones develop out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mission is to rescue us. Humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back from the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. We're rebuilding. We'll find something. Some new technology... We always have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Who's going to find it? The universities are a joke. People like you are reduced to scavenging just to get by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The earth has had enough of us. We have two, maybe three generations left. Then our time here is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns back from the glass, anger growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've known this for how long? And you didn't try to tell anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would be the point? So humanity could spend the last fifty years of its life fighting over the scraps? It's better that they don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins to argue, then stops. He knows enough histo to know she's right. He looks at the withering crops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're looking for a planet with oxygen. Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new home for humanity. We'll set up a colony, then return to bring more people across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'd still only be able to save a few hundred. Maybe a thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be better if we all died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks him directly in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I don't have a clue what Case thinks you could add to the mission. You can come with us or you can stay here and wait to die. I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But make no mistake -- this mission is our last chance. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the wilted corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks Murph back to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Brand, who holds his eye for a beat, the turns back into the light of the underground facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper buckles Murph into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's airplane touches down heavily on the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper carries his sleeping son into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald is sitting at the kitchen table, lost in thought. Cooper has told him everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get older, sometimes you just want to sit back and watch it all play out. Your life. Your kids' lives. The whole crazy story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think I'd be around for the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go. I have to look after the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been preparing these boys to be on their own since their mom died. Besides, I'll be here to look after them, same as I've always been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a responsibility to them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You do. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks back out the window, thinking. The night sky is filled with stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, duffel slung over his shoulder, stands by the doo He gives his son, Tom, a hug. Murph is nowhere to be seen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks to the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is sitting at his desk, crossing out numbers on a s covered with math. Cooper steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a packed suitcase sitting by the door. The boy looks up, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been doing the math, dad. I weigh about 85 pounds. Now that's an extra ton of fuel. But if-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to stay here, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you talking to grandpa. I'm like you. I don't fit here, either. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper puts an arm around the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's going to be important work to do here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears are streaming down the boy's face. Cooper takes his watch off. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to hold onto this. Will you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hands Murph the watch. The boy nods, saddened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not coming back, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will come back. I promise. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph shakes his head, but the sadness remains. He knows this is goodbye, even if his father doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart breaking, Cooper hugs his son and turns to the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Piper Cub touches down. Donald is at the controls. Cooper climbs down, pulls out his bag. Reaches back in an grips the old man's hand to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns and walks toward the bunker. The doors open and Tars and Doyle step out to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars ushers Cooper onto the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look so happy to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more slave when I hijack the mission and start my robot colony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Tars, then Doyle, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars was a Marine. They gave him a sense of humor to help him fit in with his unit better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great idea. A massive, sarcastic robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a cue light I can turn on when I'm joking, if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars points to a tiny LED over his eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Maybe you can use it to find your way back to the ship after I blow you out the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at him. Tars looks back, deadpan. After a beat, the little light turns on above his right eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to the bunker begin to grind closed. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks in, still looking for a place to put his thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand sees him. He smiles in greeting. She doesn't return the gesture. Instead, she holds up the telemetry board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like this one, you get to help me find a replacement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is riding in a small rubber zodiac struggling to p on a wetsuit. Brand is GUNNING the engine, guiding the ti craft to a point in the middle of the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering where you've been getting your supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We knew we'd need decades of parts and materials. The government was getting rid of some things. So we arranged to take some off their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts the engine and hooks the boat up to a buoy. She tosses a compact rebreather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to use one? (off his look) You just breathe. Tap my arm or bang something metal if you have a problem. And don't get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her rebreather and begins looking over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're a salvage diver now? I thought you were a biologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be just the one thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to have a lot of backup where we're going, Cooper. We all need expertise in at least three fields. Except for you, of course. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that she rolls backwards out of the boat and into th water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hastily fits his rebreather and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sinks underwater and begins swimming after Brand, is descending at a rapid clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a flashlight and turns it on. A tiny beam picks out details at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stops breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom of the ocean is covered with an entire fleet o the US navy. Nuclear subs. Battleships. Destroyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper remembers to breath again. Then he hurries to catc up with Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper holds the light as Brand efficiently disassembles ballistic missile and removes the telemetry board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds it up for Cooper. He nods. She swims on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, dripping wet, holding the telemetry board, strugg to keep pace with Brand through stacks of equipment and y of research and experimentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can set that down over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sets the board down. His eye is drawn to a bizarre experiment -- an ant colony built into a massive spinning centrifuge. Brand notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't know what kind of gravity to expect. We experimented with collective organisms in high g environments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking ants with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans are also collective organisms. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought humans were more solitary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I not surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the tiny colonies of ants struggling to g about their business in the raised gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a paradox. Life couldn't form without gravity. No stars. No planets. The component pieces would just drift apart. But too much of it and you're trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's guard relaxes a tiny bit as she talks about her w The moment passes quickly, and she continues on into the stack of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches with the rest of the crew as Case pulls up the holographical maps for their journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand steps into the back of the room. Cooper notices her and nods. She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've updated our mission parameters based on the data from the probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case switches the map to a vista filled with stars and bl holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on our latest modelling we think the region on the far side of the wormhole is the center of a galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case zooms in on the center of the hologram: an incredibl bright mass with plasma jets firing off in either directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROTH, 50s, the crew's brilliant and blunt physicist, zoom the map in, revealing, at the center, a black heart. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. A black hole. There are several in the region, but this is the largest -- a billion times heavier than the sun. I call it Gargantua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it? It's a shame we won't get to see it up close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like that, wouldn't you, Roth? Falling into a massive black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would answer a great deal of questions I've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case continues. Doyle leans over to Cooper, conspiratoria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Roth. He's nuts. But Case says that means he's ideally suited for space travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case repositions the map near a much smaller black hole t is orbiting Gargantua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're headed for this smaller black hole. Roth calls it Pantagruel. We think the ice planet is here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case draws a finger through the air, leaving a red trail. He traces the trajectory their ship will take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We exit the wormhole here. And we slingshot around Pantagruel to reach the ice planet. This is the period in which we'll lose time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth shifts the hologram -- the stars and black holes fla onto a sheet that bends, revealing the curvature of gravi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High speed or high gravity both slow down time, relative to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trip around the black hole will take us only a few days. But far more time will be passing back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
