dialogues.text: The ship's trajectory cuts through the deep gravity well the smaller black hole to reach the ice planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on the information from the probe -- as much as five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks at the tiny ship's trajectory, threaded betwe two black holes. He looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think we're making a lot of assumptions. About the wormhole. About the planet. (points to map) The critical orbit here is incredibly dangerous. It's like walking on the rim of the volcano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too fast and we get thrown off at close to the speed of light. Too slow and we get pulled into the hole and crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we're careful, we'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find it hard to believe that someone would build a wormhole to a planet with water and oxygen just to lead us to a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were a scientist, Brand. That sounds more like a hypothesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guess. That's right. We don't have time to wait for conclusive proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess is that the wormhole is there because someone is trying to help us. The same way we used to try to help animals when they were threatened with extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Till we ran out of food and ate all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm also assuming that whoever built the wormhole has a better plan than we did. If I'm wrong, we'll die, same as we'd die here anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Roth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth leans forward, studying the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're guessing, then I'd say Brand's right. The wormhole couldn't exist naturally. I think it's there for a reason. That someone is trying to help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think we'll have no problem navigating between two massive black holes to a tiny planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'll probably be killed. (off his look) I said I thought there was a plan. Not that the plan was for us to find a planet like Earth to save a handful of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birds don't learn to fly just so that they can find another egg and crawl back into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's not the plan, then what are we supposed to be doing out there? 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep moving. Seeking. Learning. But I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't understand how they built the wormhole. What makes you think we could understand their plan, either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle gives up -- Roth is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the tiny ship tracing an improbable route towards the ice planet. What has he gotten himself into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's Father is sitting at a desk, examining the corrup data on the probe. Tars is helping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's Father looks up from the screen as Cooper walks u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars here needs to be disassembled. I figured you could do the honors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tars, sarcastic) I thought I was going to get to enjoy your company all the way to Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars hands him a plastic waterproof case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. My chassis is too heavy for the rocket stage. They have another one waiting for me in orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars turns his back to Cooper. Two flaps on the back of h torso slide open, revealing his control module.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you try to turn me into a combine harvester, I'm going to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice cuts out as Cooper removes the chip and seals i in the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's Father resumes exploring the chaos of ones and ze on the probe's memory. Cooper watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's noise. I know it's noise. But it looks too orderly. Probably just an old man seeing things. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts down the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew file into the capsule, wearing their bulky spacesuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches as Brand's Father seals his daughter into suit. He hugs her and she heads for the capsule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper straps himself into a seat next to Brand. He catch her eye. She looks away -- she's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like he's trying to reassure himself as much he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at her, confused. As he does, the entire roc SHAKES as the primary rockets begin to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we find a habitable environment, I'm staying behind to build the colony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand wipes her tears away and settles into the same fear mask she usually wears. She steals one last look out the window at Earth, then looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins to say something, but stops as the entire r LURCHES as the primary engines FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desolate island is suddenly painted in color as the r lifts off on a massive white cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph sits alone on a rise overlooking the massive co-op farms. Behind him the combines continue to work, obliviou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph watches a tiny vapor trail as it races for the heav His father's watch dangles from his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the capsule SHAKES with incredible violen as the rocket is lifted up on a giant, continuous explosi 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket sheds one stage, then another, until finally t naked capsule reaches the blackness of space and rockets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks through the tiny porthole into inky blacknes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get closer, he makes out a looming matte black structure that passes light from the stars directly throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the structure, Cooper can see a globe-li ship covered in the same refractive material: the ENDURAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door cracks open and equalizes with a HISS. Case, mor comfortable in the zero gravity environment than the huma hauls himself through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are greeted by a group of robots painted in the same material as the ship -- the engineers who built and have maintained the Endurance for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the robots leads Cooper through a long lab-like ro filled with machines capable of fabricating almost anythi imaginable. Cooper looks like a kid in a candy store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot reaches a vacuum-sealed package. Cuts it open, revealing a bipedal frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins LAUGHING -- Tar's new body is beautifully designed, but tiny, only about four feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to install the chip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I want to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes Tars's chip out of its plastic safety case a looks it over. The engineer opens a bay in the back of th frame and Cooper slides the chip inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frame begins its "handshake" -- lights illuminate on body, muscles flicker from a long gestation. The eyes ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, sunshine. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars takes one or two steps forward, rotating his arms -- the robot equivalent of a stretch. Cooper can barely hide his mirth at Tars's newfound lack of stature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit of a demotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars turns back toward Cooper. He puffs out his chest and suddenly his stubby arms and legs telescope, unfolding in long, svelte limbs. When he's done he stands eight feet tall, even more impressive than his earthbound frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't call it that, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out an arm and pats Cooper on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the others haul themselves into the ship. To Cooper's surprise, it's quite compact, and divided into t chambers, like nestled spheres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is tiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle, squeezing past him, smiles at Cooper's surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle pats Cooper on the back. Cooper begins hauling gear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In complete silence, the Endurance detaches from the spac station and rolls gently away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, its nuclear engines fire and the Enduranc begins to accelerate steadily away from the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engineer robots who built the Endurance watch as thei creation disappears into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their mission is complete. One by one, they shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew watch through a translucent section of the ship' hull as the Earth gets steadily smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they settle in for the long journey to the wormhole. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars is hunched over a small communications relay, one ha is holding a paint brush -- he is making delicate strokes painting the relay a bright blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches him for a moment. Tars looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the comms relay. It will allow us to talk to earth, even on the far side of the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. So why are you painting it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars looks almost bashful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It helps me calibrate my fine motor control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars double checks his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned it during the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tombstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches him finish in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches a highly-compressed video of his son, Tom, talking about school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said I can start an agriculture class a year early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go, Dad. Hope you're safe up there. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom gets up to leave. Donald sits down in his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Coop. I asked Murph to record you a message but he's still... well, he's still angry with you. I'll try again next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video cuts out. Cooper stares at the darkened screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, Brand and Tars are moving the bundles of coloniza equipment into bins along the wall of the craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars pulls a stack of equipment out the stack and stows i against the wall. Cooper copies the procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They labor in silence, working their way along the hull. Cooper gets quicker with each bundle, keeping pace with T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. It's difficult to gauge mass in zero gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do these things weigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four tons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the incredibly heavy bundle spinning easi in his hands. He tries to stop it. Catches his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks his hand away, then pushes himself after the spi bundle, trying to stop it before it can damage the hull. Tars helps him catch it inches from the hull wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand floats over to Cooper, smiling at him the whole tim with an exaggerated grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles, taken aback by Brand's sudden friendliness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it lowers your blood pressure. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at his hand. Blood is pouring out of his pal in large glistening bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, slightly embarrassed, is seated while Case is hun over his hand, sewing the meat of it back together with perfect little stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. The anesthetic is working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I mean how is your mood? You seem to be developing good relations with everyone on the mission. Except perhaps Ms. Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry about my hand and I'll worry about my mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only five percent of my resources are devoted to human anatomy. Ten percent is the mission protocol. The rest is human psychology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are floating in a total vacuum in a plastic ship powered by nuclear engines. But the most dangerous thing onboard is the three pounds of organic material in your skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're such a liability, why take us along? You and Tars could build the colony without us. You wouldn't need to bring food or oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because humans, despite your obvious physical shortcomings, are better at surviving than we are. Your programming is better than ours. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans aren't programmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case stops, looking Cooper in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you prefer I was honest? These things can be uncomfortable for humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they program you to be condescending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not supposed to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case finishes the stitches. Ties off the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans are good at surviving because evolution gave you magical thinking -- the idea that your relationships mean something. You can't explain the feelings, so you think of them as irrational. But they're not. They're programming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My relationships aren't programming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. You believe it so much you won't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would that make us better at surviving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I die, the last thing I will see will be a diagnostic of my own power cycle. Would you like to know the last thing you will see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hesitates. Case senses the jump in his heart rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation is making you uncomfortable. We should stop. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing you will see before you die will be your children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mind does this to you to get you to fight a little harder to survive, to try to return to them, even if death is certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks away, overcome for a second with emotion. Ca watches him, gauging his mood, whether he has said too mu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins recording a message. He looks unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've almost reached the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in case anything happens, I just wanted to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you boys. And I hope whatever your lives become, whatever is coming your way... you make the most of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stops recording. Looks at the equipment, thinking over. Erases the message. Stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he steps to the door he notices Brand watching him thr the window. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps out. Brand looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be able to communicate with Earth even from the far side of the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles, grateful for this small kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine how tough it would be to leave your kids behind. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never had any? I thought I was a pariah for only having two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to settle down when you've spent your life waiting to leave the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the holographic model of the black hole system. The ice planet looks precariously balanced, orbit the smaller black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange place to look for a new home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to get too close to the surface of the sun, either. Black holes are a more stable supply of power than stars in many ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think there's a plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. (looks at him) You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I just think we're on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the impossibly complicated system of blac holes orbiting each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the ship, the sun is a distant light, not much big than the other stars.

dialogues.speaker: CASE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We've reached the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship slows as it nears a tiny, crystal mouth, just fo meters or so in diameter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case looks at the wormhole on the screen. It glows with t light of stars billions of light-years away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deploy the comms relay. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper moves to the communications touchscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The relay is released from the ship, and we finally get a look at Tars' paint job -- the stubby device looks like a 20th century mail box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The relay drifts in space. A signal light illuminates as sends a test packet of data to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches the comms screen. After a moment it TONES it receives a data packet from Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone take their station for transit. We're heading into the wormhole mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the rest begin folding away equipment in the control room and moving into the outer layer of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case initiates a sequence on the keypad and the nuclear engines disengage themselves from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nuclear engines drift a safe distance back from the s and then snap tight on their tether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew move into the tight, claustrophobic outer layer the ship. They will have very little room as the ship pas through the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars detaches his legs in order to take up less space dur transit. Then he tethers himself to the hull wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case is the last to join them. He detaches a small contro module from the console, then pulls himself into the oute hull and seals the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case presses a button on the control module. With a GROAN the hull walls of the ship begin to BEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's hull begins to CRACK open, revealing the inner chamber. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHUDDERING continues. The crew watch nervously as the control chamber below them suddenly opens itself to the c blackness of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship silently rolls itself into position, pointing th opening in its hull toward the wormhole mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, the Endurance pushes itself forward, closer and c to the crystal-like mouth. Finally, it envelops the mouth bringing it into the open chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crew watch, the wormhole mouth is positioned in th center of the inner compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case presses a sequence key on the control panel and the ship's hull closes again, trapping the wormhole inside it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a GRUMBLE, the ship begins contracting, squeezing it down around the wormhole mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes a deep breath as the center of the ship begi gently lowering itself into the wormhole mouth, feeding i into the wormhole from the inside out. Cooper watches as Doyle is swallowed into the compressing ship with a GRUNT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to make a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's turn: he is fed into the hole, legs first, then waist, torso, and, finally, his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endurance shrinks as it sinks from the inside out int the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, it's gone. The only thing left behind is the comms relay, drifting in space, waiting for a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship continues to slide through the wormhole. Through the outer hull they see images of themselves repeating -- trick of the narrow collar of space they are sinking thro Cooper smiles at himself. The experience is unnerving. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere. Nowhere at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere is still pretty damn claustrophobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hull is intact. Thirty more seconds transit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, the ship slides gently, silently, through t wormhole. The quiet is eery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a point of distortion appears in the hull next Cooper. It looks like someone is pushing against the hull of the ship with a giant finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening to the hull over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull integrity is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distortion moves along the hull, growing in diameter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what your display is telling you but something is happening over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, along the hull, Doyle speaks up, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a problem over here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is watching a separate distortion move across the i wall of the ship. This one seems to be TWISTING the mater of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the point in front of Cooper detaches itself fr the outer wall and moves through the space in front of hi bending the empty space itself, distorting the ship behin it like a sphere-shaped magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the hull... it's inside the ship... it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth watches as the distortions move through the ship. Hi curiosity doesn't make anyone else feel any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are they, Case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It could be gravitational turbulence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twisting sphere in front of Doyle begins to grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle puts up his hand to defend himself. The sphere abso it, twisting Doyle's hand. Doyle CRIES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand is twisted completely around, impossibly mangled But Doyle, hyperventilating, isn't in any pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bending your hand. It's bending the space around your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sphere begins to pass through Doyle's body. Doyle is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sphere in front of Cooper makes contact with him, als He holds his breath as it touches him, squeezing and distorting his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't turbulence. Look at the way they're moving -- it's like something's examining us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches the sphere distort his arm, running along length of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you ask it to stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, as quickly as they appeared, the distortions va For a moment, the crew is silent, still spellbound by the encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM sounds. Suddenly, the inner chamber begins to distort from a spherical shape to bispherical: two sphere joined. The ship GROANS as if it's being pulled apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wormhole is splitting into two paths. Radiation is pouring from one path to the other. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case stares at the controls. Decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the second mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of our testing involved opening the ship inside the wormhole. We have no idea what might happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle reaches over to an auxiliary panel and punches in a sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the hull cracks open, creating a channel through which the radiating mouth can escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening in the ship allows the pressure to begin to concentrate on one fracture point. The ship SHUDDERS as it's squeezed along its axis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case punches in a code and the ship begins to close again painstakingly slowly. Finally, the ship calms as it close around the original wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're reaching the far end of the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the wormhole mouth begins to grow inside the in chamber. What was a ball of light spreads out into a blac canvas studded with points of light -- like looking into universe through the wrong end of a telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper presses himself against the wall and holds on as t hull beneath him opens outward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endurance emerges from the opposite end of the wormho from the inside out. It drifts in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, the crew are silent, taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth is looking through the translucent panel on the hull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are on the warped side of the universe. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vista is dazzling -- an ocean of massive stars and bl holes, some adorned with jets and brilliant gas disks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the center, like a king at the center of his court, is Gargantua, plasma jets spewing from its poles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew pull themselves back into the control deck from outer hull. Their incredible surroundings are visible in all directions as Endurance passes the light into the cab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reconfigure the engines and test the communications array.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew break themselves away from the view and get to w Roth begins adapting his models of the local system with real observational data pouring in from the ship's instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pulls himself to the comms post. PINGS the relay they left on the far side of the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue and white comms relay LIGHTS up as it receives a packet through the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a nervous moment, the comms computer TONES with a response -- they're still in touch with the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars finishes reeling the nuclear engines back in from th tether and locks them into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth's updated model appears on the monitors. Brand stare at it, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible. We haven't activated the engines yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's skin illuminates, overlaying a plotted course top of the view. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are moving, very rapidly, on a course that leads dir between the black hulks of Gargantua and Pantagruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth. Why are we moving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at the stars, then back to his model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smaller black hole. We're much closer to it than the models predicted. We're being pulled by its swirl. Very quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew looks out through the hull. They are being pulle into Pantagruel's swirl -- a glittering disc of matter spinning at high speed around the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks behind them. The wormhole mouth is rapidly growing smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle. Fire the engines. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's engines FIRE, straining to fight the irresisti pull of the supermassive black hole. They won't be able t fight it for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being pulled into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at the instrumentation for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be pulling us on exactly the trajectory we modelled. If we try to fight it, we could push ourselves off of that trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case stares ahead into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should turn off the engines. Let the swirl take us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the modelling was wrong, then we can't be sure about anything. We need to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case thinks it over. Decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut down the engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. The ship drifts for a moment in the swirl, then begins to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship accelerates as it is pulled by the irresistible force of the black hole onto an inspiraling orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew watch as the ship hurtles around the black hole higher and higher speeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky overhead begins to spin due to their motion -- fa and faster until it becomes a blur. The ship begins to GR as it appears to be pulled in two different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is now speeding around the black hole at incredi speed -- one revolution every four seconds. The crew are suddenly SLAMMED against the hull in opposite directions some towards the black hole, some towards the opposite si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at his model, which shows the projected path o the ship. It looks perilously close to the event horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the tidal gravity caused by the black hole. It means we're right on the critical orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comms screen lights up, TONING again and again, as it receives a long garbled update. Then it shuts down. Coope drags himself along the hull until he reaches the control

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost contact with the relay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case joins Cooper at the comms screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they're distracted, Doyle maneuvers himself over to the engine control. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One long garbled transmission came in. Then nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the ship is JOLTED as the engines fire at full power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew looks over. Doyle is standing by the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't let you kill us. We have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines strain to fight the swirl -- but they're hopelessly outgunned by the gravity of the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of reversing course, the Endurance begins to spee up, as it plummets closer and closer to the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle's face sinks as he watches the controls -- on the 'volcano' model, the ship is now passing the crest and spiraling towards destruction. He has made a tragic mista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't it slowing down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being pulled towards the event horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS begin sounding throughout the ship as the projecte course on Roth's model shifts, showing the Endurance bein pushed up the rim, past the critical orbit and down towar the black hole's event horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case takes control of the ship, trying to fire the engine forwards to speed them back up to safety, but it's too la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines don't have enough power to push us back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would if we used it all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still trying to understand what Roth means as T locks himself into the engine compartment. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars tears open the engine's control panel and begins overriding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars rips out the cooling circuitry. Then, holding on tig he fires the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew watch as Tars holds the engine, blasting it at f power into the swirl. The engine heats up white-hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prime the remaining engine. When he detonates it, we'll only have a few seconds. If we overshoot we could be pulled into the bigger hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth moves to the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure yourselves. The ship should be able to withstand the blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Tars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crew watches, Tars continues to hold the engine ev as the casing around it begins to melt. Finally, it EXPLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars is thrown backwards from the explosion, tumbling thr space as the ship is ROCKETED upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is SLAMMED by the explosion. Cooper and the rest of the crew are SMASHED against the hull. Doyle is knocke unconscious. Brand steps over to him and cradles his head trying to protect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Roth's model, the course slowly pushes outward, out of the danger zone, back to the original delicate orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they near the original orbit, Case fires the remaining engine, pushing them back onto the outspiraling orbit. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be close, but we're going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the instruments. Points to a tiny radar contact receding towards the massive black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars. His transponder is still working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's instruments TONE every few seconds as it communicates with Tars' onboard computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's being pulled toward Gargantua. We can't help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew watch, helpless, as the tones grow further and further apart. Then they stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Doyle, anger rising. Then he looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endurance slowly spirals back away from Pantagruel, t sky slowing as the orbit grows longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a tiny speck of light appears in front of the sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth watches as the Endurance races back away from the bl hole and into a perfect orbit around a tiny ice planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks up from his screen, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roth and Doyle study the frozen planet below, Cooper t in vain to signal the relay on the Earth side of the worm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and Case are having a private conversation away fro everyone else. Cooper walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't contact the relay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand ignores him at first. She nods at Case. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me? We're not able to communicate back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves him off. But she looks shaken by something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already checked it. It's electromagnetic interference. We'll try again in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins to ask her what's wrong, but she moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks up from his monitor, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a signal. But it's local.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar CHIRP plays over the ship's speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining probes. We found them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the monitor. The probes ping the ship with their locations, which pop up on the monitor. They're all clustered in one spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could they all have landed in the same place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case programs a course that will lock the ship in orbit a the probes on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship settles into orbit a few hundred kilometers abov the surface of the ice planet. It can't get any closer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space below it is choked with hundreds of tiny moons a cruder version of Saturn's rings. The moons are hurtlin around the planet at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand ushers Doyle into the landing module. Cooper object

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bringing him along? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need all the help we can get. Besides, the alternative is to leave him on the ship alone. You think he'll still be here when we get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps aside, allowing Doyle onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lander detaches from Endurance, rolls over on its bel and FIRES thrusters to sink towards the planet's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew watches, fascinated, as the ship descends, navig between the moons that hurtle past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moons are vastly different than our own; potato shape and only one to two miles in circumference, they are hugg in a close embrace with the ice planet, only a few hundre thousand feet from the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lander touches down on the ghostly surface of the pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the hatch HISSES open and the team steps out, led by Case, holding a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team sets out, moving slowly in their cumbersome suit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit by the nebula, the surroundings are a little brighter than a full moon on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that there's much to look at. They are standing on a sea of ice, which spreads for miles. In the distance, sma rock formations break through the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand takes a surface reading of the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe was right. Looks like significant amounts of oxygen trapped in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case leads the way, drawn by a signal only he can hear. H walks fifty yards, then stops on a gentle slope that lead down into a small valley. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other probes should be directly beneath us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case and the others begin digging into the hillside. Coop is drawn to a small mound in the middle of the valley, fo feet high. He takes out a small folding shovel and begins scraping at the ice and snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case hits something solid. But it's not a probe. He digs around a little more, then reaches up and hacks away at t hillside, revealing the outline of something metal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door. They're not standing at the base of a hill -- it' a shelter. The crew stands back, unsure what to make of i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet away, Cooper cuts enough of the mound away to reveal something flexible -- fabric caked with ice. He scrapes away the snow, revealing a bright patch of red fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the flag of the People's Republic of China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could the Chinese have gotten here first? The federal government kept the wormhole a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case shrugs. He has a soldier's gallows humor about his o employer's ability to keep anything a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't do a very good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case reaches for the door of the shelter. It's sealed shu with ice. He wrenches it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case steps into the shelter, followed by the rest of the crew. His lights pick up several years worth of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case steps up to an equipment locker. Forces it open. Ins are half a dozen black probes. Exposed to light, the prob begin TONING like the one Cooper found in Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese must have captured them. So they couldn't return to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stare at the probes for a moment, taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how did the probe that Cooper found return? 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more immediate question is what happened to the Chinese expedition. There's no sign of their ship in orbit. And they never returned to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth picks up an ancient vacuum sealed package of pickled egg. Virtually none of the rations have been eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand scrape ice from one of the other small h surrounding the valley, revealing another structure. Coop forces the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand let themselves in. The shelter is well stocked with food and equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is taking readings with a radiation detector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole place has been dosed with huge levels of radiation. What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the pieces of a modular, one-person rocke a last-ditch means of escape, stored, untouched in the shelter. He steps back, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Taichung mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mars mission? The Chinese claimed it had been destroyed on landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks over the relay log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never landed. Not on Mars. Four human crew, fifteen robots. The log says the base has been here for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case's familiar voice comes through the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CASE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I've found something. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The structure is filled with drilling equipment. Cooper a the rest of the team stand at the edge of a three-foot ho that has been drilled into the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A descending rig is anchored to the top of the hole. Doyl and Case struggle to pull themselves out of the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes down for a hundred and fifty feet, then stops. Tunnel's old -- the ice has reformed at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to descend to take some samples. Cooper, want to make yourself useful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins to say something, then bites his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper emerges, loaded down with several containers of Br equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he struggles through the wind and snow, his radio pick up data chatter between the mother ship and Case. The com are just noise. After a moment, Case's voice cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: CASE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Get back here, Cooper. We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper continues to wade through the snow. Suddenly, he trips over something, dropping the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks back. He tripped on a white plastic post sticking out of the snow. He dusts it off, to reveal a picture of a Chinese Taikonaut smiling in his flight suit This is a grave marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sweeps his hand through the snow, revealing three more white posts with pictures. The entire human crew has been buried here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth and Case are looking at a portable monitor, showing projection of the nearby system -- the ice planet is a sp orbiting the local black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire human crew is buried out there in the snow. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks up from the monitor and assesses the situation with his usual detachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what killed them. This planet isn't the only thing orbiting this black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth zooms the monitor in, revealing a tiny, impossibly-b object appearing at the horizon of the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a neutron star. The black hole shields the planet's surface from it for twenty hours at a stretch. Time's about up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Brand looks rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do we have left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we die. The radiation will cook us alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around, their predicament settling in. Case walks over to the edge of the mine shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about returning to the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough time. Case is right. The ice can shield us from some of the x-rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would take a thousand feet of ice to shield us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand gives up on the argument, sheds her equipment and c herself to the line to follow Case down into the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Doyle, then follows her. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper descends into the shaft. The only light is from hi suit's light array.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the bottom of the shaft, which opens into a sm cave, the ice ribbed in wave-like patterns like the seafl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pocket formed by gas. There may be more below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice below them reveals nothing but murky blackness. Case has found some of the equipment left behind by the Chinese -- a battery-powered drill and a pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never make it far enough down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. How much time do we have, Roth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth checks his watch with his usual detachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three minutes or so until we're fully exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rad meter Brand is holding begins to CHIRP with activ the radiation levels are rising. The ice will not be enou to protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sees that Brand has exhausted herself with the pic He takes over for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drill that Case is operating GROANS as the thirty-yea old battery runs out of charge. Case casts it aside and begins SMASHING at the ice with his bare hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is looking at the walls of the ice pocket, looking fissures. Her lights pick out something in the ice. She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny black flecks. Brand, ever the scientist, forgets the predicament and begins chipping at the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case continues to pummel the ice with his hand, which is badly smashed. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls off the hand and continues to hack away at the i with the stump, trying to save his crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is examining a piece of ice in her hands, which con several black flecks. As she shines her light on them, th FLUORESCE, giving off a tiny flicker of light, like a fir Brand steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things... they're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth joins her, looking down at the tiny creatures trappe in the ice. Brand shines her flashlight over the ice agai but nothing happens. Roth takes the depth meter dangling a lanyard from Brand's suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your light they're responding to. It's this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth takes the depth meter and waves it over the ice. Suddenly, the black flecks begin to shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-rays. They feed on them and emit visible light. They've found a way to survive here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at the shimmering light of the tiny life-forms trapped in the ice, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case hammers down with his arm, gouging a deep hole in th ice below. Suddenly, GAS sprays back up at him. He's foun the gas pocket beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Roth's rad meter begins BEEPING frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, a tiny ball is orbiting into view from the dark side of the black hole -- the NEUTRON STAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its humble size belies its power. As its rays hit the ice the ice CRACKLES with energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand steps back from the ice in awe as it begins to glow The microbes are absorbing the x-rays and emitting light. Within seconds, they are bathed in an incredible glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Cooper stops, awed by the beauty of the display. Onl Case is unmoved, continuing to SMASH at the ice with the broken end of his wrist. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at rad meter) They're absorbing most of the x-rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough, unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a CRACK as Case punches into the ice. Cooper lo down -- a great fissure has opened in the ice beneath the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case, wait--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case PUNCHES again. Suddenly, with a great BANG, the ice floor disintegrates beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper falls. For a moment, the only light he can see is from Case, falling calmly a few yards beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they fall, the light from the microbes trapped in the above sweeps across the inside of the cavern, illuminatin the floor of the massive cavern thousands of feet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock formations they saw on the surface are actually tip of a mountain range extending into the distance, disappearing into the ice above as if it were cloud cover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The base of the mountains is covered in a thick jungle-li foliage that runs into a perfectly-still inland sea. On t far side of the sea, another mountain range stretches int the distance, supporting the thick ice and rock cavern ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper only has a few seconds to take this in -- he is fa towards the huge inland sea below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds before impact, a tiny warning light flickers on i his helmet: IMPACT DETECTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a small drag chute EXPLODES from a panel on the back of suit, slowing his fall. Airbags EXPLODE on his le and torso to cushion the impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper SMASHES into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper comes to underwater, as liquid is flowing into his suit from his shattered helmet. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles pour out from his suit and Cooper GASPS as his he fills with water and he begins to sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sinks, Cooper pulls off his helmet, then tears off pieces of his suit. He forces himself through the neck of the suit and then swims upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to surface when he remembers where he is. He hesitates, just beneath the surface, lungs tightening as runs out of oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper breaks the surface, COUGHS out water, and takes a panicked breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits. Nothing happens. He opens his mouth again and breathes in almost pure oxygen. He can breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treading water, he looks around. Spots lights in the wate below nearby -- Brand, in her suit, is sinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dives down and struggles to haul her up by the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper breaks the surface, looks at Brand. Her mask is al broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She refuses at first. Water is bubbling into her suit thr the open mask. Finally, she takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your suit is filling with water. I'm not going to be able to hold it much longer. I'm going to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you're going to let go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand takes a deep breath and Cooper lets go of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand sinks. Cooper swims down, following her, ripping aw at her suit. The tear-away seals on her suit are stuck fa damaged in the fall. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper finally breaks them off. Brand pulls herself out, free, and they swim for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper drags himself out of the water and onto the beach. He turns back to offer Brand a hand. She waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were supposed to be a collective organism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives up and lets him help her out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit together, soaking wet, trying to catch their bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper feels the rocks beneath him, which are translucent like glass, and polished to an impossible shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see Case dragging Roth and Doyle, still in their suits, out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle and Roth have stripped down from their suits and ar breathing in the pure oxygen atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case and Cooper are pulling modular pieces from their equipment packs to form a small shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is taking readings with her instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygen atmosphere. Pure water. Temperate climate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still think this is a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the tree line, less convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we can climb up the mountains back to the ice. We're down to three suits. We'll have to send someone ahead to get a fourth. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm not going anywhere. This is our new home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand picks up some of her instruments and a sample case hikes into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper finishes constructing the modest shelter. They loa the suits and the rest of their gear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of Brand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still taking samples. If you find her, tell her to head back. Night should be falling soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guess is as good as mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hikes into the jungle to look for Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper finds Brand taking samples from the tree-like life forms, which are wildly different from their counterparts back on Earth, piled in torturous coils, as if frozen in struggle to punch through the canopy to reach the light a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is incredible. The organisms trapped in the ice above absorb x- rays and emit light. In return, these plants absorb the light and emit oxygen, which feeds the animals trapped in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand cuts off a sample and drops it into the case. The transparent wall of the case magnifies the structure onto the glass automatically. She compares it with the flecks she collected in the ice above, fascinated. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. I think they're the same organism at a different stage of the life cycle. (shows him the sample) It's fractal. No individual cells -- the structure repeats all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the sample, then continues scanning the j around them, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of big life-forms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soil's been disturbed. So something's been moving. But I haven't seen anything. (notices his look) Cooper... are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stops scanning the trees, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think we should get back to the shelter before night falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, the light from the ice above begins to fade -- neutron star must have orbited out of view. Night is fall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. If there are any large organisms here, even predatory ones, they're not going to attack us -- they have no idea what we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that. You just have blind faith this place is going to be some kind of Eden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand stops. He's struck a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (truly pissed off) Faith has nothing to do with it. You know what you are, Cooper? You're just another in a long line of people saying 'no.' That this isn't going to work. And frankly, I don't have to convince you. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on this mission because you're another pair of hands. You want the truth? I told Case we should bring another robot over you. At least then I could just reprogram you to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. Something has caught her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just -- I could have sworn it just moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the thick, knotted trunk of a tree. Puts a hand on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, the ice flickers out and the darkness begins to descend, more rapidly than on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the tree SHUDDERS. Then, the bark begins to ooz over Brand's fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand snaps her hand away and steps back. Even for her, this is too much. She turns back to Cooper, who is lookin at the jungle around them, spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how plants don't usually move? Is that a universal rule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There really aren't any rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around them, the life-forms begins to melt toward the ground, breaking down into different, smaller forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to stay calm) Remember, we're the aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps back as several pieces of the nearest tree d onto the ground and begin scuttling toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold very still. Don't make any sudden movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the pieces join together, stacking themselves up a staggering toward him. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third piece climbs onto the first two, looking for a go place to hang on. After a moment it hunkers down on top, forming a crude head. Thirty eye-like structures blink op on the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skin of the life-form begins to flicker with a dim li like the animals trapped in the ice above, bathing Cooper and Brand in a warm glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature creeps closer to them, taking them in. Coope tries his best to seem non-threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature lurches toward him on three legs, then its h splits open and it BELLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Now we run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand doesn't argue. They turn and sprint through the tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand smash headlong through the jungle. At fi they're running from the rumbling, smashing melee behind them. But as they run, the entire jungle around them begi to break apart and move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, they're surrounded. The jungle is complet disassembling itself into a million different pieces, eac one a different size and shape than the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to reach the shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head off, crashing through the melee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case, Doyle and Roth are standing in front of the shelter finishing the day's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle turns around. The jungle is breaking apart and craw down the beach towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case and Roth look up to see the organisms picking up spe as they move towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth begins to step out towards them. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating. I think-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case grabs him by the arm and pushes him bodily into the shelter after Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case pushes the door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crouch inside the shelter as the organisms begin POU at the walls, trying to force their way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, Cooper can see the gleaming water of the inland se light still flickering in patches from the ice above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand begins to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Cooper forces his way between two writhing creatures, steps through, and falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gasps as he surfaces from the ice-cold water. Bran floats past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river appears to flow randomly down the slope, with g reason -- the forest rearranges itself every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, the ground drops away again and the water rushes o it in a torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper catches himself at the last minute, grabbing a thi tree branch with one hand and, a second later, Brand with the other as she slides past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the branch in Cooper's hand illuminates and wre itself out of the rock -- it's a limb of a huge colony organism. It shakes Cooper loose and they fall again... 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand surfaces first. She grabs Cooper and hauls him up a out of the water. She smiles down at him, a little smug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creatures begin splashing down into the pool behind them, if imitating them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stumbles to his feet and Brand guides them backwar into a small cave carved into the rock above the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand CRACKS a glow stick, basking the cave around them i soft light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, horrified, the pool and the rocks in front the cave fill up with creatures of all sizes, as they tum down the hill in what appears to be a battle royal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, it looks like Brand and Cooper may go unnot Then, a three-foot-tall creature with a dozen legs creeps its way toward the entrance to the cave. Another follows, and another, until the cave entrance is full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around the cave, frantic. He picks up a rock Brand, scared but still thinking, takes the rock from his hand and drops it back to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's game theory. The best move is always to cooperate at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By "cooperate" do you mean let it eat me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These organisms have no interest in us. They survive by photosynthesis. All they need is light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are they killing each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're outnumbered, Cooper. So unless you have a better idea, I suggest we make nice. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures move toward them hesitantly, then faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands stock still as the creatures gather around him. Several of them join up into bigger animals to get a better look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them wraps itself around his chest and begins prod at his shoulders, then his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be calm) What is it doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a colony organism. It's trying to incorporate you into its structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it to incorporate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, the creature on his chest extends four spin pointed feelers and reaches gently into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper holds his breath as the organism taps against his teeth. Its skin has a roughened texture, as if incomplete and it appears to be searching for the same texture on Cooper's skin, without much luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bored, the life-forms climb back down off of Cooper. The last two creatures link up in an imitation of Cooper's lo body and attempt to walk across the room like a human. Af a moment, the creatures tumble to the ground and flail aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still breathing hard as the cave empties and he and Brand are left alone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand steps to the edge of the cave and watches, fascinat as the creatures resume wrestling and battling each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're killing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They don't bleed... they don't die... they're just competing... trying out different shapes, looking for the best one. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches as a hideously-awkward-looking, five-legge beast stumbles past and tackles another animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say they have a long way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do this every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, a two-foot-long creature with one huge cla scuttles along the ground, grabbing smaller opponents and smashing them apart, then sorting through the wreckage an adopting some of the writhing parts as its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about the movement is endearing, the way it experiments with each piece -- less like a massacre and m like an over-caffeinated self-assembling erector set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a massive, lumbering creature SMASHES down in f of the claw beast. No match, the smaller creature turns t scuttle away. Too slow. The larger organism brings one club-like limb smashing down on top of it. After a moment it lifts its claw -- the two animals have become one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new organism lumbers away through the jungle, happily snapping its new claw at larger opponents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The behavior changes as the animals get bigger and bigger. More sophisticated. More calculated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the larger organisms square off, circling each oth lights pulsing up and down their bodies in a fierce displ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are they competing for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand shivers -- it's getting colder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and Cooper huddle around a small chemical fire they brought with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the sample of the fractal wildlife in her case. It's moving around, splitting apart, reforming, try to find a way out. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These creatures are billions of years older than we are. But they're relatively primitive. They haven't developed tools, culture, language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. No one knows how intelligent life began on Earth. But the surface of this planet has virtually no craters. No impacts. It's been sheltered by the local black holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference would that make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not enough has gone wrong here. Maybe bad luck is the key to intelligent life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph's Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Maybe our interaction with them will push them over the top. Maybe that's part of the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) The plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it so hard for you to accept that someone might be trying to help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is silent for a moment. His mood darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in Denver during the first year of the famine. I was just a kid. We kept waiting for someone to come help us. People starved to death sitting on the ground, waiting for someone to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her) I only made it because I realized that nobody was coming to save us. We were on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks away. The memories are never that far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? After the things I saw... you want to know why I don't believe that someone would be trying to help us? Because I'm not sure we're worth saving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sleeps. After a moment, Brand steps back out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
