dialogues.text: Brand exhales great streams of frosted breath -- the temperature is well below freezing. The first flickers of light are visible in the ice above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures are huge now, forty or fifty feet tall, bat each other more and more slowly. As Brand watches, the largest of them beats down his rivals, climbing to the to of the heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the beast reaches the top, it freezes, as if stuc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, the ice begins to shine brighter and brighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the beast on top breaks apart, unfurling into p to catch the light. This is what the contest has been abo a better place in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand pick their way their way through the fol which is now perfectly still, absorbing the light. Cooper looks at the plants, wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand sees his trepidation and laughs at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to move now, Cooper. They need to spread themselves as thin as they can to absorb the light. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper leads the way, pushing through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he stops again. Brand, annoyed, pushes through t foliage to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, honestly, you're a bit of a-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. Cooper is standing at a sheer cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out on the plain below is a massive, fortified bas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive blast doors, long since smashed in, open onto a building that has been overrun by the local fractal wildl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case steps inside first, his worklights flickering on. Co and the others follow him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is barely recognizable -- the fractal life has covered the tables and chairs. Water pools on the floor a light streams in from a massive hole the fractal animals have punched in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the Chinese picked a fight with the locals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue through the ruins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deeper they go, the less fractal wildlife they find. The barracks are pristine -- hundreds of perfectly made b waiting for colonists who never came, like one of the bun the federal government used to keep in case of nuclear wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the size of this place. They built it for thousands of people. But no one came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks around, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will. We can salvage it. This place will save us years. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why didn't they come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese government collapsed, same as ours. The people who knew about this mission probably died years ago. We had the same problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth finds a sign he likes the look of -- it points to th science levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive door GRINDS open and the team steps into a mass complex of underground laboratories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the others carefully make their way through a that has been completely emptied -- no desks, no chairs, nothing. The only thing that remains is a solid ball of matter in the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth stares at the ball, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were testing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the walls, which are bowed inwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth is looking at the ball, which appears to have been b from layers of different material. The outermost layer is flattened steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks. The outermost layer of the ball indeed looks like a steel chair, flattened with incredible force onto surface of the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand opens the door to the next lab. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab is empty, except for a large metal sphere on a pedestal in the center of the room. A black box is set in a cavity in the sphere, wired to a control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the walls of the room, which have been bo inwards, as if some great force had been pulling from the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything in here is bolted down. (looks at sphere) What do you think this thing does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth finds a control panel. Wipes off an inch of dust and begins tinkering with the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't turn it on until we can figure out what it does, Roth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth continues to look over the controls, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: BRAND, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Cooper. Come look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand calls out from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper follows Brand's voice down the stairs to a sub-bas beneath the lab level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps into a huge space filled with a near perfect holographic representation of the local system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper joins Brand and Doyle in the map, looking at the incredibly detailed models of each star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case is standing at a terminal, hacking into the camp's records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found the Chinese mission logs. They're encrypted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks over. Looks over the terminal. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old military-grade encryption. It's not very robust. (looks at Case) No offense. Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper punches a few keys into the terminal. Opens up the terminal. Scans the motherboard. Takes Case's rifle and SMASHES one of the chips on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terminal comes to life. Cooper hands Case his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should open up most of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case is silent for a beat, parsing the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got here twenty years ago. The human crew was killed by radiation the first day. But the robots survived. They built the colony and radioed home. But they didn't receive a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one was listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few years they discovered a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't say. Their science team took the ship to continue exploring the system. It says they found some kind of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The word literally means 'treasure.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case skims through the rest of the logs, large portions o which have been redacted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The science team returned after five years with a new technology. They began the experiments upstairs, then they left again and never returned. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They've deleted their mission plan. There's nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what the problem is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is manipulating the time component of the map, slow down the passage of time, reversing it, speeding it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle speeds up the map until the ice planet is nearly a blur, speeding in its orbit around Pantagruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a small black hole moving into the system. Too small for us to have seen in our survey. It's not going to hit the planet, but it's going to come close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny black hole soars through the system. Although it misses the ice planet, it deflects its orbit by a tiny de After a dozen more orbits, the ice planet dips down close Pantagruel's event horizon and is torn apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and the others watch as the sequence rewinds and re the planet is pieced back together again and ejected, the pulled back in and torn apart. Over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place isn't paradise. It's doomed. Just like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand, watching the sequence in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does this place have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few years. A decade at most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle turns to Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Brand. She is in disbelief, staring as a lifetime's training and optimism are torn to pieces. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't understand... why are we here? What are we here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down. Brand's upset is turning to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are we here for? I trained my whole life to reach this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Cooper, questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... maybe Roth's right... maybe we just don't understand it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down. She knows he doesn't believe what he's saying. He's been right all along -- they're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a tiny moment, all hope is lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, with a distant RUMBLE, the building begins SHAK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case, what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nighttime. The native life- forms are mobile again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLE grows more intense, as if the entire building being gently shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's closer than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLE grows. As Cooper watches, Case's rifle slides free of the desk. But instead of falling, it simply hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he realizes the same thing is happening to them -- h boots no longer have traction with the ground. After a se everything in the room is floating an inch off of the gro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick -- hold onto something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out to Brand but it's too late -- suddenly the no longer floating, they're falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're falling up. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, Brand and the rest of them hit the ceiling. Coope picks himself up and adjusts to his surroundings -- up is now down. He helps Brand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case doesn't answer -- he's looking up at the control equipment for the holographic display, which is GROANING under a load it was never built to handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case grabs Cooper and Brand and pushes them towards the stairwell as the control panel TEARS free of the floor an CRASHES towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper falls into the stairwell -- now they're being pull up and sideways through the stairwell, like an Escher painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand pushes Cooper out of the way as debris from the con panel orbits past them back up towards the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to hang on but the force is becoming irresistibl dragging them along the wall of the stairwell and back to the lab upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand wedges herself against the railing as objects and d are SMASHING against the door to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is trying to hang onto the handrail but his grip sl and he CRIES OUT as he falls towards the door to the lab, SMASHING it open. Doyle disappears up and into the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper slips trying to help Doyle. Brand reaches out for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Cooper is pulled through the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is pulled through the door and past the control pa He reaches out and grabs the underside of the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dangles, the panel cutting into the meat of his hand, trying to get his bearings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth, Doyle, and everything that hasn't been bolted down either pressed against the sphere in the center of the ro or is orbiting around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth, who is laughing, jubilant, shouts up to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The control panel is beneath you. See if you can turn it off. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper slips as he tries to reach the controls. Finally h finds the controls for the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it. Hold onto something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth and Doyle crawl up the side of the mass and hold ont the support wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hits a key on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the room inverts again, reverting to a normal gravitational field. Cooper floats for a second, then top back to the ground, along with everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand stumbles in to find Cooper sprawled on the floor as Roth and Doyle hang onto the sphere for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth, back on terra firma, is looking at the tiny black b he's pried from the center of the sphere. Cooper is looki over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found a way to make gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not make it. Adjust it. Dial it up, or down. I think they were experimenting with it -- firing these into the black hole to try to save this planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that from one tiny box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth has hooked the box up to a terminal and it scrolling through the incredibly sophisticated machine code, trying parse how it works. Cooper looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It barely uses any power. I'm only beginning to understand what it does but I think it sends a signal out into the bulk. It must tap into the same technologies that were used to create the wormholes in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means whoever built the wormhole probably doesn't exist inside our universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the tiny box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how did the Chinese develop the technology? This would take decades, maybe hundreds of years, to create.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever they went, they found something that allowed them to build it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came back here and tried to use these devices to save this planet. But they didn't work. Nothing would be strong enough to weaken a black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could work with it. Try to improve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're missing the bigger picture. The robots had strict mission parameters. They were told to build a colony and report back. They tried to. But they failed. Like us they were fixated on this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't realize they had already found something that would save us all. (holds up the box) This. This is the prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? Earth's gravity is like a prison. But this is like a master key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could build more of these, we could turn down the earth's gravitational field enough to save millions of people. We wouldn't have to pick a handful of people to survive. With this we can save everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever we want. We don't belong in any one place. Can't you see that now? Not Earth. Not this place. Nowhere. If the human race is going to survive, we need to keep moving. Split up. Spread out. Fly. With this, we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case looks at the box. Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the morning we're taking this and going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle, Roth and Case set about making preparations to lea gathering space suits, equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bustle, Cooper finds Brand sitting alone, staring the sample of fractal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this isn't exactly what you trained for. But I think Roth might be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't help this planet. This creature is doomed. Unlike us it doesn't have anywhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fractal organism almost seems to be looking at her, t to comprehend. But it quickly loses interest and goes bac to breaking itself into pieces and reforming into differe shapes, trying to escape. Brand sets it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Cooper and the others prepare to head out. They are laden down with gear -- space suits for the return tr to the lander once they reach the surface. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth carries the gravitational prototype.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way through the ruined entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to hurry. We only have a few hours to reach the ice before nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stops. He puts a hand on Brand's shoulder. He poin to the tree line. Something is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make any sudden movements. They can't hurt us if we're unarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, three ROBOT MARINES step out of the jungle, wea raised. They are wearing ghillie suits, pieced together from dried dead pieces of the local foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under their camouflage, they looks identical to Case. Wit one key difference -- faded red and gold insignias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case steps protectively in front of his team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHINESE OFFICER steps forward, rifle levelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ni Hao. My name is Technical Sergeant Liu, 177th reconnaissance Marines, Army of the People's Republic. Welcome to New China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put down your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Liu speaks in the same even tones as Case -- the were probably built in the same factory before the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case keeps his rifle raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a scientific expedition, not a military one. We are making our way back to our ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I cannot let you do that. We will provide food and shelter and await further instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sorry if this causes you any inconvenience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant is polite, but firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This planet is being pulled into the black hole. We all need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will await further orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further orders aren't coming. Your government is gone. It ran out of money, same as ours. You're on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can offer you food and shelter as long as you require. The facilities here are quite comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liu's tone remains polite, but there's no hope of changin his mind. Cooper takes a sidelong glance at Brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're never going to let us go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mission is a humanitarian one, wasn't it? You were sent to start a colony. Like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our mission was to prepare for the evacuation. This site was deemed unacceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This device that you have built -- this could save millions of people. We need to get it back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand points to the device Roth is holding. The Chinese robots seem particularly unhappy with this development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These technologies are the property of the People's Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have been ordered to prevent anyone from taking them. We have been ordered to prevent anyone from following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following? Following where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liu pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will await further orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name means six. Where did the others go? One through five? Is that who were not supposed to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case turns to look at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the others up to the lander. Keep going. No matter what happens, don't come back for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case moves. Fast. He FIRES one shot at the nearest robot, disabling it, then hurls himself at the remaining two, tackling them both over the edge of the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches them disappear into the void below. Grabs Brand and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper picks up the rifle from the destroyed marine and b hiking up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew hike towards the ice above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below they hear a metallic BOOM as something heavy hits something else -- Case is still fighting. They keep movin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are high above the Marine camp, only fifty feet or s below the massive ice roof of the cavern. The Chinese hav blasted a tunnel into the ice leading back up to the camp above. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This high, the air is bitterly cold. Cooper and the other are hunkered down, trying to keep warm, waiting for night fall so that they can climb back up to the lander without being cooked by the neutron star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, above them, the light begins to flicker out. The crew begin pulling on their space suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand checks on the fractal wildlife in the sample case - she is bringing it with them. Cooper catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave them all to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hefts the case and they begin climbing up into the ic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand leads the way, the lights from her suit cutting int the drifts of snow as they make their way slowly back to lander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they reach the lander Cooper spots lights emerging fro the ship. He raises Case's weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Liu's marines steps around from the back of the la Cooper FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marine collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and the others race to the lander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the last of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to stick around to count them. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper points to a damaged section of the ship's hull -- marine has torn open a section, revealing damaged hardwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main thruster fuel supply. We're not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down. They're stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the escape rocket at the Chinese base camp? One of us could fit into it. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter how many of us make it. We have to get this back to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at the moons orbiting overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can the secondary thrusters still fire on the lander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks over the craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. But we don't have nearly enough power for lift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth holds up the small gravity black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth sets off running towards the Chinese base camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper drags the pieces of the escape rocket out from the shelter. Assembly is semiautomatic -- Cooper lifts the pi up and they snap together, forming a crude two-stage rock designed more for a robot than a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's complete Roth wedges himself inside, clutching black box -- he barely fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can reach one of the moons in low orbit and turn up its gravity. As it passes overhead it should be able to slingshot the lander away from the planet's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we need to take the box back to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need this -- only the idea. The knowledge of how to build it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper remembers something. Heads back into the shelter. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth follows Cooper into the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper opens the storage crate. Picks one of the probes a random. Sets it down on the bench next to Roth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins rigging up a connection between the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to image the operating code and the architecture onto the probe's hard drive. It'll be garbled, but it should give you and me enough to rebuild it when we get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the probe filling up with data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. But you'll make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transfer is complete. Roth hands Cooper the probe, an takes the black box himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a one-way trip for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Cooper can respond, Roth heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth squeezes himself into the rocket, hugging the black to his chest. Cooper and Brand help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't right, Roth. We can find a way for all of us to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the only way. Keep the lander upright and fire the secondary boosters when the moon passes overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You need to make it home. You're going to need to build more of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at him, heartbroken. Roth smiles. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand the plan, now. Whatever happens, you have to keep exploring. Keep learning. One good idea isn't enough. You'll need more and more of them just to survive. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand turns to follow Cooper back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, Roth's rocket LAUNCHES on an explosive cloud. In seconds it's high overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper checks over the hull, which is intact. Doyle is in looking over the controls. He steps back outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control systems inside are online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost sight of the rocket. Do you think he made it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find out soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is looking off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks up. A robotlike figure is limping through th snowstorm towards them. Cooper raises the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he makes out the insignia -- it's Case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Doyle run out towards him. They reach Case as collapses in the snow. He's badly injured -- one leg torn off at the knee, one arm mangled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle and Cooper drag the crippled robot back into the sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drag Case into the lander. Doyle checks over the shi controls. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper moves to the door. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Brand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nowhere to be seen. Cooper looks out onto the ice. Brand is heading back out into the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit. If I don't make it back, just keep going. (points to probe) Get that thing home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket tucks in close behind one of the moons orbitin the ice planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket fires to maneuver closer and closer to the moo surface -- the tiny moon doesn't provide enough gravity t attract it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the rocket is close enough, Roth detonates the explo bolts holding him inside and leaps for the moon's surface

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles to grab hold of the craggy surface. Behind him, the rocket smashes apart against the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth finally gets a good hold. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below him, the view is incredible -- the ice planet curvi into the distance, Gargantua rising over its horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth looks at the black box in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is a hundred yards from the lander by the time Coop catches up with her. She is digging in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her arm but she won't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally finds what she's looking for -- the sample ca The tiny fractal life-form is huddled at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head and turns back to the lander. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth is watching the ice planet pass by beneath him. He finally sees the distant peaks of the mountain range as i punctures the ice near the Chinese camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment he enjoys the view -- the distant hulk of Gargantua rising over the horizon of the shining ice plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a final breath and activates the black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, the moon's gravity is magnified a hundred mill times over. Roth is instantly crushed as the moon collaps around him into a tiny sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand are only thirty yards or so from the lan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the ground beneath them begins to RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns back. A mile back the ground begins to tear apart, heaving massive chunks of ice and rock into the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth's moon is racing overhead, TEARING up a massive stri of the surface's planet as it nears them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The energy being unleashed by the tiny box is incredible millions of times more powerful than an atomic bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spray of debris is forming a rooster tail behind the moon, rocketing up from the planet's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper has almost made it back to the lander. Behind him, Brand stumbles. He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is pulling herself up. Behind her, the THUNDEROUS EXPLOSIONS as a strip of the planet's surface is hurled i space have almost reached them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the ship. He'll never make it if he waits for Brand. He turns back to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches Brand just as the moon's gravity hits them -- they're hurtled off into space. He grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds later, everything -- the entire ice sheet, the se and rocks deep below -- is hurled up after them. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and Cooper embrace as they rocket up through the th atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around. They planet's surface is breaking in pieces around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured if you were floating out into space, you'd want some company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds onto her as they fall up and out of the last of planet's thin atmosphere and the blackness embraces them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between you and utter solitude, Cooper, frankly, I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the apex of their climb and the gravity of the planet begins to win out. For a moment they float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you were right -- too much gravity, or not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, forgetting their predicament for a moment. The stare into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they begin, very gently, to fall back towards the ic planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the lander maneuvers beneath them. The airlock opens to catch them -- Doyle is at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and Cooper pull themselves aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper closes the door and Doyle rotates the lander outwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle FIRES the engines and the lander continues ascendin into space as the debris around them begins crashing back down towards the ice planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks out the window: 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon continues tearing up a massive canyon in the pla surface as it circles out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, a shadow looms in the darkness: the Endurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand, Cooper, and Doyle pull themselves out of the airlo and scramble to take control of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below them, the surface of the ice planet illuminates as neutron star's x-rays begin to reach it from the far side Pantagruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle finally gets the ship straightened out. Its sole remaining engine FIRES, rocketing the ship back towards t dark side of the planet, out of view of the neutron star, and back towards the original wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm setting a course for the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand make eye contact -- Brand gives him a ti awkward smile. He returns it, then descends below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper props Case up against the workbench. He pulls down replacement arms and legs from storage bins. Unwraps them from their vacuum sealed plastic and bolts them back onto Case's chassis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper finishes attaching the arm. Case rotates it, check the function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We've already set the course, skipper. We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hauls himself back up into the observation level. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is setting the controls. The ALARMS on the controls have finally abated -- they're out of the danger zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper heads to the communications equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know why we weren't able to hit the relay. It's not interference -- the blue-shift from the black hole is more than we thought it would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins re-calibrating the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, wait--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship PINGS the relay on the far side of the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. The ship cached one long garbled transmission when we first fell into the swirl. If we account for the blue shift then the computer might find something in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper brings up the last garbled transmission they recei The computer begins re-analyzing it, piece by piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- the blueshift also means we've lost time. More time than we thought we would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot... Cooper, maybe it's best if

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comms equipment TONES as it translates a packet. Then another. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a FLOOD of communications, one packet a day, hundred and hundreds of packets: images, videos, audio messages f family and friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches, horrified, as the images play out across screen. He is watching the lives of his family play out a light speed. Finally, the packets slow, then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the results, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle joins him, staring at the screen, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper tries to PING the relay again. Nothing comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The relay will have lost power years ago. That's why we couldn't contact it, even after we reached the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still problem solving, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could bypass the relay. Send a conventional shortwave signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a tiny portion of the signal would make it though the wormhole. Besides, no one will be listening anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comms screen is dead. No movement. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Brand, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew, didn't you? You and Case figured it out when we landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought... I couldn't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you could. You're brilliant. You know everything. 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper... we needed to keep going. I'm so sorry. Your children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not children any more... if they're even still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the important thing is that we're going home, now. And we have something that can save everyone. It's more important than the people we left behind-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle cuts her off, filled with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy for you to say. You didn't leave anyone behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Brand, his anger softened by sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at him, grateful for this small kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you were upset -- your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down, filled with sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. But there are other people who still need our help. There's still time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's controls TONE in ALARM. Brand and Cooper turn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case is standing at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case finishes typing in a sequence on the command control Presses the "execute" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last nuclear engine begins to detach from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot turns from them. Cooper notices that the contro module snapped into the back of Case's chassis is wrong:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's red with a gold star. It's not Case at all. It's Liu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I have my orders. No one follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liu stares, satisfied, as the nuclear engine spins away f the ship and back down toward Pantagruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper SMASHES Liu from behind. The robot tumbles to the ground, the fight gone out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Doyle roll the robot over and Cooper reaches f his control module.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one follows-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper rips the module out. The robot freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is already at the controls, trying to regain contro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instruments TONE, alerting the crew to their position

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is spinning back down towards the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... We're being pulled back to Pantagruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, frantically checks the controls, firing the remai boosters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let that happen. We'll lose more time... too much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boosters are no match for the deadly pull of the blac hole below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ship's guidance, they watch, helpless, as the ship climbs back up the volcano rim towards the critical orbit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As on their first trip, the black hole grows to dominate bottom of the sky, and the stars above them become streak time is speeding for them as they are whirled down into t deep gravity well around the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, trapped, decades begin to play out in the system above them. They watch as the ice planet whirls ar them, orbiting the black hole dozens of times. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the ice planet plunges past them towards destruc As it reaches it slows, until finally it reaches the even horizon, just as they saw in the projections. Nothing has prepared them for the reality:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice planet is SMASHED apart with stunning violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the sample of fractal life. Now they are united -- they are, in all likelihood, the sole survivors their planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle points to the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wormhole. Look -- it's being pulled into the black hole as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch on the holographic model as the wormhole's orb converges on the event horizon of the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's orbit mirrored the ice planet's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will happen to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be destroyed, like everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper struggles to pull himself over to the communicatio screen. Sets it to make a shortwave broadcast. Brand open her mouth to point out that it's futile, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the crew of the Endurance. We... (gives up on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, I'm sorry. I'm sorry I didn't make it back, like I promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In silence, they watch as the wormhole -- their only way home -- vanishes beneath the event horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time are we losing? 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decades...hundreds of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of those people back home... none of them will make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Doyle watches the controls the ship continues to spira towards the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. We're going to be pulled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the controls, an idea forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself down. Hauls himself across the deck to pick up Liu's chip. He plugs it into a diagnostic tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case said the Chinese found something else. The location was scrubbed from their records. But I bet he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper fires up the chip. Begins sorting through the onbo memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle watches the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper concentrates, poring over the numbers. Finally he begins feeding coordinates into the navigation computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Can we reach it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the map. The point appears on the far side of Gargantua. Brand studies the trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use the thrusters to keep us on the critical orbit. Then slingshot us towards Gargantua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thrusters STRAIN to push the ship back up towards the critical orbit. 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the tidal gravity SLAMS them against the walls the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the thrusters fire again -- a tiny push, but jus enough to launch the ship clear of the black hole, like a rock out of a slingshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship races toward the massive hole in the sky below t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship picks up more and more speed as it soars closer the massive black hole's event horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky closes to a tiny hole above them. Gargantua is swallowing their view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the radar, which is choked with debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have a few minutes before we're swallowed into that thing. What are we even looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the radar, a tiny empty spot appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to screen) That? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks. In one tiny region on the back side of the black hole, the debris simply seems to vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle FIRES the thrusters again, pushing the ship towards the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endurance spins, shifting paths slightly as it contin to race closer and closer to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They study the controls. The projected path shifts, one degree at a time. Finally, it appears to put them on a pa to hit the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle shuts off the thrusters. 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to be able to slow down. Hold onto something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He locks up the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is tumbling through space, racing toward the sec wormhole. It is massive, much larger than the first wormh and it's glowing with a light as bright as a star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew brace themselves against the hull of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the ship slams onto the wormhole mouth and is pu violently into the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light fades, Cooper and the others come to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is rapidly dimming from pure white, fading to a deep red, then infrared, finally darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks out. Checks the instruments. Looks out again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Blackness as far as the eye can see. No stars. No planets. Just inky darkness stretching on forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand joins Cooper on the deck. Together, they look out a the blackness that surrounds them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's like we entered the wormhole and never left it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand checks the instruments. There is nothing for the sh to model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nowhere to go. They drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days go by. They check the instruments. Still nothing. It's as if they have left the known universe altogether. 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle sits down. After a moment, he turns on the screen a cues up a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His children appear on-screen, giggling, pushing each oth trying to get a prime spot in front of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle cups his face in his hands and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper above his bunk, stares out into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand watches him from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I should have told you. I didn't have the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should watch the recordings. You should know what happened to your kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand watches her father talking to her on-screen. He is twenty years older than when she left him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to make it much longer. The machines will continue to maintain the station as long as they can and the communications will run as long as the station here still has power. I'm sorry. I hope wherever you are, darling, you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen cuts out. Brand watches the static play out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle sits at the table. He has found a flair gun in one the ditch kits. It is sitting on the table in front of hi The message is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand sits down across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our last trip past the black hole cost us another 100, maybe 200 years. Which means there's a good chance we're the only humans alive anywhere. 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the last human beings should have a little more fight in them than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand picks up the sample of fractal life and places it u a lamp on the counter. It freezes, absorbing the rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, in a space suit, steps out of the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drifts out from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Behind him, the ship is a tiny speck in an ocean of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits down. Turns on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the camera turns on. Tom, his eldest son, still 15 years old, turns on the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pauses it. He can't take it. After a moment, he lets it run again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met another girl, Dad. I really think this is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom holds up a picture of himself and a teenage GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph stole Grandpa's car. He crashed it. He's OK, though. No broken bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is holed up, still watching, several days' growth beard unshaved. He's been watching for days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, Tom is a grown man in his 20s. 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a surprise for you, Dad. You're a grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom holds up an infant wrapped tight in swaddling. The ki is BAWLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Grandpa said he already earned the "great" bit so we just leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next message begins. Tom is in his 30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dad. I'm sorry it's been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa died last week. We buried him out in the back forty, next to Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we'd have buried you, if you'd ever come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, gallows humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph was there for the funeral. It's been a few years since I've seen him. He's been down in the Gulf Coast. He's an engineer. I guess someone followed in your footsteps after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to this. I know that. All of these messages are just out there, drifting in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gone. You're never coming back. And I've known that for a long time. Lois says -- that's my wife, Dad -- she says I have to let you go. So I am. 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up to turn off the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever you are, I hope you're at peace. Goodbye, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image freezes, Tom's hand on the camera, then breaks apart into digital noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at it for a second. Then rises to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the screen flickers to life again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good-looking man in his late 30s turns on a camera. Coo recognizes him instantly. It's Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks at the camera for a long beat, clearly unsure about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dad. You sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your 60th birthday today. Thought I would celebrate with you a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I understand why you left. The corn is dying now, too. Tom says there's less and less at harvest every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses. Lifts up his hand and scratches his stubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pauses the message. He looks carefully at the scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is wearing his dad's watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper lets the message play. Tears are streaming down hi face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rot's setting in. I guess you were right for clearing out while you had the chance. (reaches up to switch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, old man. I hope you made it. I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video cuts out. 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A message appears on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Final transmission." Relay powered down 05232087

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns off the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is seated, alone. Almost every compartment has bee opened and emptied -- debris is swirling through the compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand walks in. They sit in silence for a moment. When Cooper speaks, it's clear his sadness has faded to a gall humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a single drink on the whole ship. What kind of mission is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Doyle's been experimenting with the coolant from his spacesuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think we're the last humans alive anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe. (looks him in the eye) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it, then? That's all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down, saddened by his own words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happened a billion times over. Stars explode. The pieces drift in space. Gravity pulls them back together. They form new stars. Then planets. Then us. We die. It starts all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the plan? The grand scheme. 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't believe in one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. But you were bringing me round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, his anger coming and going in waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was the point? What did it add up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe it just adds up to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This? You're saying the end result of ten billion years is the atoms from dead stars standing here disagreeing with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him. Bittersweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her. She takes his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him into a kiss. His surprise disappears and he pulls her to him, kissing her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their surroundings forgotten, they drift. She LAUGHS gent as they bump into a wall and he pushes off of it, sending them spinning back into the center of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls his shirt off and it hangs in space. In moments the cabin is filling with discarded clothes, different co and shapes, like a ticker tape parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the cabin, Brand and Cooper make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand embrace, sleeping, drifting in the cabin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Doyle's voice calls out from the other cabin.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's happening... it's happening again... Get up here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper wakes, careful not to disturb Brand. He plucks his shirt from the floating laundry pile and pulls it on. 126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hauls himself up into the upper cabin. Doyle is standing in the middle of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just appeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sphere of distortion, like the one they encountered in first wormhole, is directly in front of Doyle, hovering a point in the middle of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle points a finger gently at the sphere, which grows i response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand pulls herself into the cabin. Several more points appear, as if they've been summoned by the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the points twist, some of them spin, and some of them are motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think these are the creatures that built the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them begins to move closer to Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is made of... gravity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think it's in our universe at all. I think it lives in the bulk -- the space that the wormholes traverse. And it can only interact with us using gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape playfully grows around Cooper's hand, bending t space it's in, stretching the skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle GASPS as the sphere nearest him moves through his b coming to rest in the middle and bending his entire torso like a fun house mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the sphere wrapped around Cooper's hand begins moving, tugging him gently through the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next moment, all three of them are being propelled through the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a magical moment -- a communion, a dance between creatures on either side of a massive, invisible wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle exclaims like a kid on a roller coaster as he is wh around the room. 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Brand collide with each other for a second as bulk beings move them through space. They hold onto each other for a moment and then are pulled apart again as the whirling dance continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the fractal creature is involved -- inside its cage, tiny distortion ripples its fractal skin. The creature br apart and plays with the distortion around its enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Brand disengages from the dance and pulls hersel around the lab, looking for some way to try to communicat with the creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds two heavy pieces of engineering equipment and m them close to each other, then far apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulk beings soon join her, mimicking the motion of th pieces of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we communicate with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would we even start? Maybe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pull a bag of ball bearings out of a storage bin and tears the bag open, releasing a cloud of the tiny shining globes into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, nothing happens. Then, the distortions begi moving through the bearings, shifting them, rearranging t into patterns in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, they rearrange the ball bearings into clusters, th shapes spinning around each other -- planets orbiting aro a medium-sized star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our solar system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment the ball bearings break apart again and rearrange into a larger, more complicated system -- Garga Pantagruel, and the ice planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the bearings compress to a two-dimensional sheet Inside the sheet, one solitary ball bearing orbits around the stars and then pushes up, off of the sheet, into an umbrella shaped space that rises up from the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks at the tiny particle, floating alone above it universe. 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us. That's where they've brought us. We're in the bulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Doyle stare at the particle. The map is static now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around. The distortions have gone. The instruments on the ship TONE in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks through the map, sending the ball bearings scattering. He hurries to the instruments. The ship is moving -- picking up speed at a huge rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're moving us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand, looking out into the perfect darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship begins to close in on something in the darkness: tiny point of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they grow closer, they realize that it's an opening. They are inside a massive, hollow sphere. They have been the entire time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is guided out through the opening at the crown o the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below them is an astonishing sight:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our entire universe, compressed into a flattened disc, li a floor of stars. They are hovering above it, in the bulk the space between universes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand and the others stare at the incredible display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship drops down and begins to orbit around the massiv hollow sphere between them and our universe, lower and lo until it is skimming just above the surface of the sphere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, they can make out a cluster of lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cluster of lights grows as they are propelled closer: 129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a massive space station, built onto the surface of t sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endurance glides to a gentle stop on one of the upper decks of the space station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the airlock to the ship opens and Cooper the others step out, in their suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up to the airlock doors of the station, which o automatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the airlock decompresses, the inner doors open. Standing there, waiting for them, is a familiar figure:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this isn't robot heaven after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light on his brow glows and he offers them both a han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humans have taken off their space suits -- the statio has been built to be habitable by humans -- and are follo Tars through the massive facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I orbited the black hole seven times before I hit the second wormhole. Then I drifted until I found this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks around. The halls are filled with countless technological wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what the Chinese were protecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they could have built all this in just a handful of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't. It took them four thousand. (off Brand's look) Time moves very slowly here 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've been waiting for you for three hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks around at the massive facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. That's what the bulk beings wanted to give us. That was the treasure the Chinese found. Enough time to let us save ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand looks around. The facility is massive. She sets the specimen case down on a table. Even the tiny creature see in awe of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars shows them a prototype for the gravity machine. It i tiny -- increasing G around two spheres that attract each other with a tiny force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have catalogued almost everything they had built here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have taken you a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred and fifty-seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are they keeping the lights on in this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars, in answer, points to a far door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive reinforced-concrete shell shudders with the ene contained within it. The whole room HUMS with power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars pulls up a display showing the inside of the shell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny black hole spins, spewing out massive amounts of p 131.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mini black hole. A remnant of the big bang. It will power this place forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars leads them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars leads them past an incredibly sleek fleet of spacecr Cooper starts to stop, but Tars doesn't slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the room is a giant holographic globe of the Earth, perfect down to the tiniest detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not a map. This is a simulation of the Earth. A perfect simulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars touches the control panel. The map zooms in over Eur Down onto Paris. Late 20th century:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People walk through the streets. A woman stops at a newsa to buy a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars touches the controls again and the map zooms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tested each of the technologies hundreds of times, trying to find the one that would cause the least damage and still allow us to leave Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the map lights up with atomic explosions in eve city. The sequence stops, rewinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, sped up, the Earth seems to be drying up -- gr swaths of desert grow across Europe and Asia. Massive circular ships are constructed all over the face of the E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was their best solution. A massive version of the box we found on the ice planet, allowing the entire human population to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a given moment, the gravity of the Earth is dropped to nothing and the massive ships, filled with the entire 132.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: population of the Earth, lift gently off of the planet in search of greener pastures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns away from the machine, bitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why didn't they return? Why didn't they save us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand is staring at the massive map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they were too late. By the time they found this place, the people who sent them were dead. They were unable to fulfill their mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars points to the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the final problem they tried to solve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them, the blackness of the sky is punctuated with hundreds of crystal shapes, faintly leaking starlight:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wormholes. Brand looks up at them, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do they lead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars looks at an illuminated schematic on one wall, mappi some of the wormholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are millions of them, connecting virtually every planetary system in the universe. There are thousands in our galaxy alone. But the Chinese stopped mapping them when they found what they were looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars walks further. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platform in front of them is dominated by a gigantic version of the black box that Roth found on the ice plane connected to a massive power array, and pointing into the dark space above the sphere. 133.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was their final creation. They had to capture the mini black hole just to have enough power to try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several miles above the black box, one of the wormholes g far brighter than the others, crackling with radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps forward. Runs a hand on the cold, strange material the antenna is made out of. He knows exactly wha it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't interested in the other wormholes because their mission was to return home. That one leads back to Earth. The Earth they were told to return to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars walks to the controls for the device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars turns away from the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
