dialogues.text: It was only used once. The Chinese team attempted to travel back in time, to Earth just a few years after they had left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks back to Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think it works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks up at the machine, suddenly determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks out of the room. Brand follows him. 134.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand follows Cooper as he walks up to the Endurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it doesn't work. Time travel isn't possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. If it worked, the Chinese would have suddenly discovered all of these incredible technologies. But they never made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go back, Cooper. You can slow things down, but you can't ever go back. Our home is gone. (off his look) You listened to all of those messages from your family. If you had made it back, we would already know. There would already be some evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you try to use it, you'll die, just like the people who built it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts an arm on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth was right, Cooper. We have to keep going. Keep exploring. We have an obligation to try to survive. From here we could find a thousand places where life could thrive. And you're going to return to the one place where it can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her, resolute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Doyle check over one of the sleek Chinese spaceships. 135.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is checking over the controls of the ship. Brand walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks Brand back to the Endurance. The ship is pac up and repaired. Brand is looking over their work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have taken one of the other ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's done all right by us so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand holds up a small sample case containing half of the fractal life-form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take this with you? It's the last of its kind as well. Thought we should double its chances of survival. In case I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes the sample and looks at the tiny creature in trying to escape. He sets it inside the ship. Turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Up there, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points up into the great darkness above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars steps down. Moves over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curious. It's my nature. See you down the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars shakes Cooper's hand. Heads onto the Endurance. 136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us. Please. You wanted your whole life to explore. This is your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares at her. This is what he has always wanted. And he has to turn it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I have to find out what happened to my sons. I promised them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand sees the resolve in his eyes. Knows there's no way change his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a man who keeps his promises. Make me one-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you're done... come find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately. Not wanting it to end but knowing that it must. Reluctantly, they separate. Brand turns bac to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls herself onto the ship. Cooper steps back outsid and watches through the tiny window as the Endurance lift off and disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches as radiation pours out of the wormhole hig above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pulls himself on board. Doyle is at the controls. He keys the controls and the ship lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men sit in silence as the ship arcs away from the space station and closes in on the wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hears a familiar CHIRP. He turns around: 137.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe they took from the ice planet is belted securel into one of the seats, filled with the garbled machine co of the gravitational machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get back to earth, you and I can try to make sense of the code. Rebuild the gravity machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares at it, suddenly realizing something. He unbuckles himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands and walks over to the probe. Traces the familiar stars and stripes carved into its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares at the probe, putting it all together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's going to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean. This is the probe I found in Galveston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below them, the wormhole breaks as it reaches another wor mouth that the Chinese have dropped down to a lower gravi well, creating a time machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wormhole mouth is FLARING with radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brand said there'd be some evidence we'd made it. And there was. This. (holds up probe) But only this. Everything will be destroyed except for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward Doyle. Doyle stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, but you're not touching the controls. I'm going home. 138.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper moves closer to Doyle. Doyle pulls out the flair gun. Points it at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to do this. We won't make it back, but this does. The secrets are already right on it. Maybe someone found it. There's hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't get to go with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not stopping me. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle forces Cooper into the ship's lander. Then he close the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pounds on the other side of the glass, trying to r with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing craft detaches from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches, helpless, as Doyle's ship races ahead tow the glowing wormhole mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship speeds toward the next wormhole, the radiatio suddenly FLARES, annihilating the ship and everything in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's landing craft spins away from the wormhole mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole opens in the sky with a FIERY EXPLOSION. As the radiation subsides, all that shoots out of the hole is a vaporous wisp of atomized metal, and a burned, blackened probe, which hurtles toward Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe collides with a satellite, hurling debris into upper atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe's onboard camera documents its journey. Fragmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The probe HURTLES through the atmosphere, toward North America, the Gulf Coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The probe SMASHES down into a sandbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Daylight. A man is descending toward it, dangling from rope. It's Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Night. A kitchen. A little boy -- Murph -- stares at the probe, while Cooper works at it with a blowtorch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Tars pulls the probe out of the back of a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Brand's father, older, studies the probe. Gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Much later. People are moving around in the darkened base, scavenging equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combine harvester is dead in a field, service hatch ope A MAN is lying under the machine, working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man hauls himself out from under the huge machine. Du himself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Murph, 30s. He looks at the FARMER who is waiting fo the verdict. Murph shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. Auto-pilot's packed up for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make it work a little longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do anything for you. There aren't any more parts for these. Not anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. We're getting less than a hundred pounds per acre. We need to plant more, not less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks around him at the pathetic crop of corn that stretches around them. The plants are feeble, barely able to support themselves. 140.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to find us some more parts, Murph. It's getting desperate. Isn't there anywhere you can look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph begins packing up his tools, thinking it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph stares at the darkened shape of a plane under a tar He stares at the tarp, unsure if he wants to keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the tarp off, revealing Cooper's old Piper Cub. checks over the engine, lights, prop. Turns the key. Fire her up. The diesel wakes with a GRUNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph wheels the old plane out onto the field by hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient plane skirts the San Gabriels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph sets the plane down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He parks the plane under a copse of trees and climbs down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the horizon. Nothing. Is this the place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph pushes his way through the undergrowth. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's standing at the blast doors to the facility. They've been blown open with dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph lets himself inside. Lights a flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place has been gutted. Thieves and scavengers have ta almost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph finds one of the robots, or what's left of it -- it been stripped, leaving only the bare composite skeleton. The empty eye sockets stare back at Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks around the place. There is nothing left to salvage. He turns to leave. Hears a familiar CHIRP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, under a pile of rain-soaked garbage: 141.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has bothered to steal it. Murph stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph sweeps detritus off of an ancient computer mainfram that survived the looting. He hooks the probe up to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a minute, the screen fills with a picture of an ice covered planet. Then nothing. The rest of the probe's dri is filled with garbage, noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph switches off the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands. Begins to leave without the probe. Stops. Turn back. Picks it up and takes it with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph is hunched over the probe, trying to pull data off it with a defibrillator. He has incorporated an ancient laptop into the chain, and is tweaking values on it, tryi to decrypt the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His WIFE, several months pregnant, turns back to him from the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you get that thing off of the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph nods, absorbed. Keys in a final tweak to the decryp software. Hits return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the screen begins filling with data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph stares at it, wide eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, now in his 40s, is putting the finishing touches o large machine. Although slightly different, we recognize some of the components and their configuration:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crude version of the gravitational device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph double checks it, then fires up a small gas powered generator. Throws a breaker, feeding power to the unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unit lights up. HUMS. But nothing happens. 142.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, disappointed but undaunted, shuts it down and begi checking it over. He hears a noise at the door. Turns bac His daughter, Emily, 8, is standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? You said you'd take us to the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the impossible nest of wires. Shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let me get my jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph picks up his jacket from the workbench. Next to it the bench is a shortwave radio playing STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at machine) What is it supposed to do, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph switches off the lights and they walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the radio CRACKLES to life in the darknes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio, garbled) This is the crew of the Endurance... Murph... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signal crackles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, 50s, slightly gray, sits at his kitchen table. He hears a distant RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up. His wife is standing by the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the barn. She's been tinkering with your old projects. 143.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph stands up. The roof of the barn is visibly shaking. He steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph moves towards the barn, concerned. The shaking is growing stronger -- the entire structure is buckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, now 18, backs out of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... I'm sorry... I made some changes to the machine. I think I did something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph puts an arm around his daughter and as they watch, entire barn IMPLODES. Their tractor begins sliding toward the wreckage of the barn, chunky tires plowing up the soi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the RUMBLING STOPS as the power lines short out a FIERY display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dust clears, Murph and his daughter examine the me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire barn has been crushed into a tiny ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph looks at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember what you changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide-eyed, she thinks about it. Then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is North America. But it doesn't look much like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Nature has just about wiped the slate clean. Most the vegetation is gone, and unchecked winds sweep across barren plains. Patches of ice lie think on the ground, as if a heavy snow has come and gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Chinese spaceships descends through the thick clouds above and settles gently onto the plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch opens and Cooper steps out. He takes a cautious look around. He is holding the fractal life in its small container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clouds are threatening, but the weather looks calm en right here. 144.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper starts to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remarkably, part of Cooper's old house is still standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands in the middle of his kitchen. Two walls are missing and the rest is collapsed in a heap. But he can still see where he used to feed his kids breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has kept his promise. Several hundred years too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hunkers down, staring at the space where his kids used to be. Rainwater covers the ancient formica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has taken him years to finally reach this place. He ha had plenty of time to come to grips with what he might fi But nothing has prepared him for this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is completely alone. Nothing is left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still sitting there when the ice storm hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unchecked by trees or vegetation, the wind rockets throug the house, blasting Cooper and pelting what's left of the structure with fist-sized hail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes shelter against the remaining wall. He's goi to have to sit this one out -- the hail and winds are the brutal descendants of the weather he knew. They'll finish him off if he steps back outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he watches, the pool of water on the kitchen floor fre over in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shivers, pressed against the wall. The storm is st raging outside. He is freezing to death. He has to move now or he will die. He pulls the hood tight around his fa and stumbles outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper makes his way through the blinding snow. He tries find his way, but the ship has been consumed by the blizz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles to the ground, dropping the glass case with t fractal wildlife in it. The case shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper tries to stand back up, but his strength is dwindl 145.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he watches, the fractal wildlife creeps tentatively ou of its broken habitat. It forms together against the cold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, it burrows into the ice. As it does, the ice glows faintly. It seems to be right at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper laughs, glimpsing the outline of a plan. Was this what the beings who made the wormhole intended all along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper suddenly spots the outline of the ship through the driving snow. He stumbles back up to his feet and struggl a few more steps, then stumbles again, spent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he sits down in the snow to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his senses flicker in and out, he is struck with memor of his boys, so vivid he reaches out for them, crawling forward in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, and laughs, remembering what Case told him abou what happens when humans die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles to his feet and stumbles a few more feet, eventually coming to rest just steps from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes a final step. Finally, he collapses under hi ship, as the wind continues to HOWL around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the snow clears for a moment, Cooper is alone on a vas arctic tundra. He will die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper wakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in a sunlit room. A breeze rustles the curtains as makes its way in through a large open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits up. As he a does, a control panel on the wall TONES gently, as if in response to his movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands and looks around. He can see sunlight through t open windows and hear people -- kids YELLING as they play He moves toward the window. Reaches for the curtains. Bef he can, the door opens behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN in a white coat steps in, smiling warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Don't go outside just yet, Mr. Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offers him a pill) This will help with the disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper opens his mouth to talk, but his voice is cracked. He gives up. Swallows the pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute for that to take effect. It can be a bit of an adjustment. (looks him over) You had some frostbite. Nothing too serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she talks, Cooper looks past her to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bit of a coincidence, really. When the rangers found you, we were the nearest facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's coincidence? What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a lot to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor reaches for the curtains. She offers him a han Cooper declines the help and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is standing on a rooftop deck of a four-story buil in a medium-sized city surrounded by fields. But as the road and the buildings stretch into the distance, the landscape curves up, not down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire landscape is contained within a huge cylinder- shaped space station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stumbles, and reaches instinctively out. The docto catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're OK. We get this from people who move here from planetary colonies all the time. 147.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said. It was a coincidence. There was a facility closer to Earth, but they had a problem, so you wound up here. (off his look) This is the Space Station Joseph A. Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper takes in the incredible surroundings. A thousand feet above them, black specks are sprinkled over an ocean green -- Jersey milking cows grazing in a field of wild g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got someone who wants to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps inside. The room is dark, still, the only no is the labored RATTLE of an old man struggling to breathe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper steps closer to the bed. The man's skin is paper- thin. He is ancient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was moved here after they found you. He's a little old for a transfer, but they made an exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper hovers at the back of the room, unsure. He turns t the doctor, questioning. Then he notices the pictures on the old man's desk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are dozens of them. Children, grandchildren. Then the older ones -- the man's own parents. Grandparents. Cooper spots a tiny framed picture with someone he recogn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph, 80 years old, surrounded by his daughter and her family. They are standing in front of a re-opened Cape Canaveral, and a huge spaceship under construction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper picks up the picture and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor points to a shy little boy hiding behind Murph leg in the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. 148.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the old man lying in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Anthony Welling. Anthony Cooper Welling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your great great grandson. He's been waiting a long time for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's eyes well with tears. He steps over to the bed a looks down at the ancient man, teetering on the edge of d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man looks at him, eyes widening in excitement. He strains, trying to reach the bedside table. He's trying t reach the drawer. Cooper helps him open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is a simple, familiar wristwatch. The old man carefully takes out the watch. He gives the watch a few winds and, hands shaking, offers it to Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, eyes filling with tears, closes his hand over the old man's hand, enveloping both the watch and the man's h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is sitting in a well-appointed office. A middle-ag BUREAUCRAT smiles at him from the far side of a huge desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a hero, Mr. Cooper. Let's just start off by saying that. It's an incredible and... unexpected honor to have you here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us would be here without the efforts of you and the other crewmembers of the Endurance. (smiles, unconvincingly) So I don't want you to take this the wrong way. But there are some questions I've been told to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man looks petrified, like he's been instructed to gri George Washington on his expense reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot. 149.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rangers who found you reported that you had released a sample of an alien life-form into the wild. Which is, unfortunately, against regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was last of its kind. Their planet was destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The administrator cues up a series of images on his compu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rangers attempted to isolate the life-form, but it had already spread out of control. It seems to be thriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows Cooper a satellite image of north america. A considerable portion of the frozen tundra is glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper begins laughing. Which makes the administrator eve less comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me why you... elected to release the life-form back on earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper is still laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that was the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The administrator tries to smile back. Makes a few notes his file. Changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant tells me you've applied for a position with the exploration fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel like I should be pulling my weight. 150.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's admirable, Mr. Cooper. The truth is, most of the fleet's personnel are automated. There are a small number of crewed ships. But there are great numbers of candidates. Very well trained candidates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping to enroll in a course. Try to get myself up to speed on the new systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to take this the wrong way, Mr. Cooper -- like I said, you're a hero. But the truth is we have somewhat limited resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper remembers this conversation. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's heard anything from Brand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Officially, she's been listed as missing for over 200 years. Mind you, I guess you turned up eventually, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I really going to hurt anybody by going to look for her? I just need a small ship. I made a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bureaucrat looks down. Is he really going to have to tell this guy the lay of the land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Mr. Cooper. You're a hero. You're the oldest man in the human race. Don't you want to take it easy? (off his look) I hope you understand, we all you hold you in the highest possible regard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why they're never going to let you go off by yourself in a spaceship. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at his hands. He's got a couple centuries on the bureaucrat in Earth years, but looks ten years younge He puts his hands in his pockets. 151.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some good news, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know about your early life, Mr Cooper. I wrote a paper on it when I was a boy. And I think we found something you'll really enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn blows in an artificial breeze. A red tractor makes i way through the field, which curves gently up in the dist

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The machines do most of the work, of course, but we were able to get you a few acres. You're going to be a farmer again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the tractor stops. Cooper climbs down fro the seat. Looks at the front steering linkage, which is jammed with an errant tree branch. He wipes his forehead and begins working the branch out of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A robot, a similar unit to Tars, walks over. Offers Coope a bottle of water. Cooper accepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands on an observation deck, high above the hang floor. Below him, bright young things in uniforms climb into sleek-looking spaceships and prepare to set out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits in the stands, listening to the familiar crac of the bat as an intramural team from the university practices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches. He looks bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid up to bat cracks a pop fly. For a second, the cat shuffles back and forth, trying to get himself into posit But the ball never returns. The catcher YELLS out a warni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, the ball begins to slowly fall up, not down, towar the town center above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a second, the ball smashes through a skylight of a building high above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches as the kid rounds the bases, laughing. 152.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's robot sits at the kitchen table. Cooper is fiddl around in the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settings: general settings, security

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiosity. New level setting. 100 percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed. Would you like to make any additional changes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sense of humor. New level setting. 100 percent. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins putting the robot back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits on his porch, joined by the same robot as bef They watch as the space station rotates lazily out of alignment with the local star, casting the inside of the cylinder into shade, then darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow races past them. Another day. Another night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maintenance worker finishes looking over one of the sle looking spacecraft. He packs up his tools and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, two figures pick their way across the han floor, sticking to the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they reach the first ship in the line, we get a better look. It's Cooper and his robot pal. The robot is wearing a baseball cap and carrying a toolbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper gestures to the robot, who sets down the toolbox w a click against the mirror-like floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper shakes his head, annoyed, at the robot, and puts h finger to his lips. The robot nods, bashful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper waves a small handheld computer near the skin of t ship until it lights up. Then he punches in a few codes. Nothing happens. He punches in a few more. 153.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the hatch opens with a HISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper moves quickly to the cockpit of the ship. Looks ov the controls. The robot straps himself in next to him. Cooper looks up through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inky black void of space beckons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles and reaches for the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician walks back into the hangar. He walks along the row of ships till he reaches the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out into the blackness of the void. Sees a tiny glowing speck, getting smaller and smaller.
